{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Private jet firm XO just added 15 aircraft to its fleet in a major fleet expansion that will help corner the new market of first-time private jet flyers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/xo-adds-15-jets-to-fleet-private-aviation-expands-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faadc08f7d1cb0019e3ae1e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cessna Citation Ultra\" height=\"1339\" width=\"1785\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>XO is expanding its fleet to 58 aircraft with the addition of 15 light jets.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Perry Correll/Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Private aviation firm XO just added 15 Cessna Citation Ultra jets to its fleet, growing to 58 aircraft in total.</li>\n<li>It's the first light jet to be flown by XO, offering a greater variety to new and existing members over the traditional super-midsize and long-range aircraft operated by the firm.</li>\n<li>Thomas Flohr, the CEO of XO's parent company, Vista Global, told Business Insider that memberships have nearly doubled since April.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>XO, one of the largest private aviation firms in the country, is growing its dedicated fleet of charter aircraft with the addition of 15 light jet aircraft.</p><p>Starting today, the Cessna Citation Ultra aircraft will be available for charter directly through XO, offering members more options when booking private jet travel and better positioning the firm to attract newcomers to private aviation.&#160;</p><p>The light jets will roam around the country as part of XO's now 58-aircraft-strong floating fleet model where aircraft have no fixed home, saving members on repositioning costs. They'll initially be found flying on the East Coast, as well as in the Bahamas and some Caribbean countries, before expanding to the West Coast and some parts of Canada and Mexico.&#160;</p><p>Thomas Flohr, the CEO of XO's parent company Vista Global, told Business Insider that \"explosive\" membership growth since April by nearly double was a primary catalyst for the expansion into the light jet realm.&#160;</p><p>Private jet firms across the US including XO are reporting a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-private-aviation-execs-are-preparing-for-business-travel-loss-2020-9\">faster-than-expected recovery from the pandemic centered around an increase in leisure travel</a>, encouraging expansion for the largest companies. Combined with XO's existing fleet of super-midsize and long-range aircraft, the light jet fleet will make the firm a one-stop-shop for a variety of planes.&#160;</p><p><em>Read More: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/private-jet-ceos-are-preparing-for-post-pandemic-boom-2020-5?r=tp-sub\" data-analytics-position=\"201\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Private jet industry CEOs say business will boom as the wealthy abandon airlines and reveal what they're doing now to take advantage</a></em></p><p>The move also strengthens XO's appeal in capturing the new market by offering the entry-level light jets that are more cost-effective than the larger super-midsize aircraft the firm has traditionally operated. New entrants often start by chartering light aircraft to get a feel for the industry and the perks of flying private before moving to the larger models.</p><p>The Ultra is an ideal aircraft for the popular short hops for which a large aircraft would be overkill, such as between New York City and Massachusetts Islands or Los Angeles and Las Vegas. And as the aircraft are owned by XO, getting owner approval for short flights – a common issue in the charter world where aircraft typically require approval by their owners, often an wealthy individual – won't be an issue.&#160;</p><p>Boasting a range of 1,960 nautical miles, according to <a href=\"https://www.jetcraft.com/jetstream/2015/12/textron-cessna-citation-ultra-1994-1999-2/\">Jetcraft</a>, XO can fly the jet on city pairs such as New York-Palm Beach, Los Angeles-Dallas, and Chicago-Phoenix without stopping for fuel, under the right conditions. Cessna produced the aircraft as part of its popular Citation family from 1994 until the turn of the century and during that time, it earned the title of \"Best Business Jet\" from Flying Magazine, <a href=\"https://www.jetcraft.com/jetstream/2015/12/textron-cessna-citation-ultra-1994-1999-2/\">Jetcraft</a> reported.&#160;</p><p>XO will be refurbishing the cabins and will soon include free WiFi onboard the jets. The firm just recently embarked on a fleet renewal for its Cessna Citation X and Bombardier Challenger 300 super-midsize aircraft, the latter of which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-a-newly-refurbished-xojet-aviation-private-jet-2020-11\">Business Insider toured in October</a>, giving the jets a new paint job and interior improvements.&#160;</p><p>Light jets are often the perfect compromise who want the benefits of private aviation but don't need a Gulfstream or Global Express every time they fly. Even before the pandemic, these types of light jets were popular because they are the least expensive jet aircraft to charter.</p><p>Smaller airports with shorter runways are also more accessible for light jet than with larger aircraft. And with service to regional cities being cut by the major airlines, leisure and business travelers are finding themselves with fewer options when it comes to commercial aviation.&#160;</p><p>\"We looked at how the world has changed in the last 10 months since COVID was hitting and a lot of the commercial infrastructure fell away,\" Flohr said. \"We saw that the demand for short-term travel is needed and many flyers living outside or working outside major aviation hubs, they're facing restrictions to get from A to B.\"&#160;</p><p>XO members have always had access to light jets, as well as over 2,100 aircraft through what the firm calls the XO Fleet Alliance, but having them owned and operated in-house allows XO to offer a consistent product.</p><p>Members can also book private jet charter flights online or through a new XO app that gives users a guaranteed price for the charter, eliminating the need to go through a third-party broker. The app also gives additional booking options allowing flyers can see different prices on different days as flexibility is key to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-book-a-flight-on-a-private-jet-charter-2020-5\">saving money while chartering</a>.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5faadc08f7d1cb0019e3ae1e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6816c3061765c082ea2a48baf6829eb9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn67@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-29-58-508_075532b128105092.webp","destWidth":1785,"destHeight":1339,"sourceBytes":78320,"destBytes":78320,"author":"tpallini@businessinsider.com Pallini)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5faadc08f7d1cb0019e3ae1e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn67@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-29-58-508_075532b128105092.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2-UyEbnNfbM:KmXRZwCs0RY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn67@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-32-516_6d6078e0cf05c4e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2-UyEbnNfbM:KmXRZwCs0RY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-37-773_3d5b2597f34bc6f2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=2-UyEbnNfbM:KmXRZwCs0RY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-32-564_ff4f73251a5151f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/2-UyEbnNfbM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn33@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-38-326_1f21f73dac7deba8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991861},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"JetBlue will soon fill its planes to capacity and is offering refunds for travelers who don't want to fly on the airline as a result","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/jetblue-will-fill-its-planes-to-capacity-in-january-2021-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafe737402d49001924efd0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JetBlue Airways Airbus A321\" height=\"1660\" width=\"2214\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>JetBlue will start filling its planes to capacity after previously blocking middle seats and restricting capacity.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Philip Pilosian / Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>JetBlue Airways will not be blocking middle seats come January 8, 2021, as more airlines start to fill their planes.</li>\n<li>Flights from December 2 to January 7 will be filled to 85% capacity and to 100% capacity after that.&#160;</li>\n<li>Only two US airlines have committed to blocking middle seats into 2021, so far.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>JetBlue Airways is joining the growing list of airlines that plan to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airlines-blocking-middle-seats-for-thanksgiving-travel-2020-10\">fill their aircraft to capacity</a>&#160;in the upcoming months, abandoning a policy of onboard social distancing that was thought to be necessary in order to restore confidence in air travel.&#160;</p><p>Starting December 2, JetBlue will increase capacity on its aircraft to 85% through the Christmas and New Year's holidays. The airline's current policy for Thanksgiving travel is to limit capacity to 75%, which blocks most middle seats but doesn't guarantee that they're all empty.&#160;</p><p>Come January 8, all capacity limits will be removed and any seat on any JetBlue aircraft can be booked. In a message to the airline's crewmembers, JetBlue President and Chief Operating Officer Joanna Geraghty said that the airline expects less full flights during the winter as travel demand usually decreases.&#160;</p><p>The New York City-based airline is <a href=\"http://blog.jetblue.com/guidedbyscience/\">citing</a> a science-based approach in removing the seat restrictions, pointing to recent studies from Harvard and the US Department of Defense that show the efficacy of high-efficiency particulate air filters, or HEPA filters, and mask usage in stopping the onboard spread of coronavirus. All JetBlue passengers are required to wear masks at all times when flying, except when eating or drinking, as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/flying-jetblue-airways-during-the-pandemic-review-photos-details-2020-8\">Business Insider found on a recent flight in August</a>.&#160;</p><p>Unhappy passengers who have travel booked on JetBlue for January 8 or later, however, can request a full refund. Travel must have been booked by November 13 and the latest day to apply for the refund is November 27.&#160;</p><p>Passenger numbers from the <a href=\"https://www.tsa.gov/coronavirus/passenger-throughput\">Transportation Security Administration</a> still show that under a million passengers are flying every day in the US but planes are filling up as airlines consolidate their route schedules. JetBlue CEO Robin Hayes told <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2020-08-13/jetblue-ceo-says-day-of-reckoning-is-near-for-airlines-video\">Bloomberg</a> in August that his airline would evaluate individual flights up to four days prior to departure to determine if they're financially viable and cancel them if they are not.&#160;</p><p>JetBlue joins Southwest Airlines, once a leading airline in the push to block seats, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/southwest-airlines-filling-planes-no-longer-blocking-middle-seats-2020-10\">which will open its planes come December 1</a>. America's largest low-cost airline cited the same Harvard and US government studies as JetBlue in its announcement last month that followed a $1.2 billion third-quarter loss.&#160;</p><p>Delta Air Lines and Alaska Airlines are the only two airlines to announce that all middle seats on their jets will be blocked through January 6, 2021, when the holiday travel season will have likely died down. Delta CEO Ed Bastian has said that he expects the policy to end in mid-2021</p><p>Hawaiian Airlines is blocking middle seats on its aircraft until December 15, as of now, and hasn't yet announced an extension into 2021. A spokesperson for the airline told Business Insider in October that the airline is confident in the current science surrounding mask usage and air filters, as well as its new cleaning practices.&#160;</p><p>The policy change also comes as JetBlue seeks a return to profitability following a third-quarter loss of <a href=\"http://investor.jetblue.com/investor-relations/financial-information/quarterly-results/27-10-2020\">$578 </a>million, announced last&#160;month. JetBlue is also planning to add a new aircraft to its fleet next month, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jetblue-unveils-airbus-a220-aircraft-built-in-alabama-photos-details-2020-10\">the Airbus A220 that's slated to dramatically boost the passenger experience</a> and replace the airline's aging Embraer E190 fleet.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f10abbeaee6a852fc2c1604?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5f9f650760afdd74338fabefe21be9fc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn71@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-39-274_e107fd72d88fc620.webp","destWidth":2217,"destHeight":1663,"sourceBytes":69352,"destBytes":69352,"author":"tpallini@businessinsider.com 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Cori Bush says several of her new Republican colleagues in Congress mistakenly called her 'Breonna' after she wore a Breonna Taylor face mask to her first day of work","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rep-elect-cori-bush-says-republicans-mistook-her-breonna-taylor-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafc68c402d49001924efc8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cori Bush\" height=\"750\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep.-elect Cori Bush (D-MO) speaks to the press outside of the Hyatt Regency hotel on Capitol Hill on November 12, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sarah Silbiger/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Missouri Representative-elect Cori Bush said that some of her Republican colleagues called her \"Breonna\" on her first day of Congress because she wore a face mask that said \"Breonna Taylor\" on it.&#160;</li>\n<li>Bush told reporters on Friday that her Republican colleagues called her Breonna \"several times\" and that the remarks were \"disheartening\" and \"absolutely hurtful.\"</li>\n<li>But the Democrat, who recently made history after becoming Missouri's first Black congresswoman, tweeted that she's still \"glad they'll come to know her name and story because of my presence here.\"&#160;</li>\n<li>Taylor, a 26-year-old Black medical worker, was killed on March 13 when Louisville police shot her eight times in her home during a botched drug raid.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Missouri Representative-elect Cori Bush said that several Republican colleagues mistook her for Breonna Taylor on her first day of Congress on Friday because she was wearing a face mask with Taylor's name on it.</p><p>Taylor, a 26-year-old Black medical worker from Louisville, Kentucky, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/breonna-taylor-shooting-police-boyfriend-say-cops-knocked-2020-7\">was killed when police shot her eight times in her home during a botched drug raid in March.</a></p><p>\"It's Day One, so I'm wearing my 'Breonna Taylor' mask,\" Bush <a href=\"https://twitter.com/CoriBush/status/1327316069221097485?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1327316069221097485%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cbsnews.com%2Fnews%2Fcori-bush-breonna-taylor-mask-republican-colleagues%2Fs%2F\">tweeted on Friday.</a> \"A few of my Republican colleagues have called me Breonna, assuming that's my name. It hurts.\"</p><p>\"But I'm glad they'll come to know her name &#38; story because of my presence here,\" she continued. \"Breonna must be central to our work in Congress.\"&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/breonna-taylor-shooting-police-boyfriend-say-cops-knocked-2020-7\"></a></p><p>The case was one of many <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/13-concrete-changes-sparked-by-george-floyd-protests-so-far-2020-6\">that fueled nationwide protests against police brutality.</a></p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Cori Bush  (@CoriBush) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1327316069221097485?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 13, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>When asked about her tweet by reporters later on in the day, Bush said that her Republican colleagues called her Breonna \"several times\" and that the remarks were \"disheartening\" and \"absolutely hurtful,\" <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/cori-bush-breonna-taylor-mask-republican-colleagues/\">according to CBS News.</a></p><p>\"This has been national news for a long time. People have protested in the streets with this name and it just saddens me that people that want to be in leadership don't know the struggles that are happening to Black people in this country,\" she said, according to CBS.</p><p>\"But it's okay because we'll educate and we'll make sure that people know who she is, what she stood for,\" Bush added.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafd0d4402d49001924efcb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"breonna taylor emt\" height=\"1124\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This undated photo provided by Taylor family attorney Sam Aguiar shows Breonna Taylor in Louisville, Ky.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Taylor Family attorney Sam Aguiar via AP, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The 44-year-old progressive Democrat <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/history-making-moments-diversity-representation-2020-election-2020-11\">made history by becoming Missouri's first Black congresswoman earlier this month.</a> She won after beating Republican Anthony Rogers to represent the state's first congressional district.</p><p>Bush has long been a vocal activist of the Black Lives Matter movement. She first attracted national attention when she led a protest in Ferguson after the death of Michael Brown in 2014.</p><aside></aside><p>In September, the city of Louisville <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/brett-hankison-officer-involved-breonna-taylor-shooting-charged-grand-jury-2020-9\">settled a wrongful death lawsuit with Taylor's family, which included a $12 million payout alongside several measures for police reform.&#160;&#160;</a></p><p>Forer police officer Brett Hankison <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/no-charges-officers-for-shooting-death-of-breonna-taylor-2020-9\">was charged with three counts of \"wanton endangerment,\" for putting Taylor's neighbors at risk during the incident.</a></p><p>Hankison's indictment and the three charges do not appear to be directly related to Taylor's death,&#160;</p><p>The two other Louisville Metro Police Department officers involved in the shooting at her home on March 13 were not charged.&#160;</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/breonna-taylor-shooting-police-boyfriend-say-cops-knocked-2020-7\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Breonna Taylor's boyfriend told police investigators he was 'scared to death' moments before the shooting</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lousiville-police-arrest-state-lawmaker-who-authored-breonnas-law-2020-9\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Louisville police arrest the state lawmaker who authored 'Breonna's Law,' during a second night protests over the lack of charges related to Breonna Taylor's death</a></li><li><a Ankel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fafc68c402d49001924efc8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn21@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-34-257_971b58aa724e9751.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fafd0d4402d49001924efcb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-38-634_97c45f8bf82c598f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lMLE13odaYs:qTzexu_f0v4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn45@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-38-512_5ca9c83b04a9e683.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lMLE13odaYs:qTzexu_f0v4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn38@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-36-262_3146eb6d1fff0827.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lMLE13odaYs:qTzexu_f0v4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn95@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-27-562_cad712e1fd02eee7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/lMLE13odaYs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn79@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-38-601_09ec5a8440f18526.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991891},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Peter Navarro says the White House is operating 'under the assumption' that Trump will serve a second term","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/peter-navarro-trump-white-house-ignoring-election-results-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafedbc402d49001924efd7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro listens to a news conference about a presidential executive order relating to military veterans outside of the West Wing of the White House in Washington, U.S. March 4, 2019. REUTERS/Leah Millis\" height=\"1747\" width=\"3494\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>White House trade advisor Peter Navarro.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>White House trade advisor Peter Navarro on Friday said the White House is operating as if the president will have a second term, ignoring the reality of the 2020 presidential election results.</li>\n<li>After Joe Biden was declared president-elect last week, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-joe-biden-will-appoint-to-top-cabinet-positions-axios-2020-3\">the former vice president has begun forming his Cabinet</a> and speaking with world leaders about future foreign policy initiatives.</li>\n<li>\"In my own view looking at this election, we have what appears in some sense to be an immaculate deception,\" Navarro said.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>White House trade advisor Peter Navarro on Friday said that the White House is operating as if the president will have a second term, despite President-elect Joe Biden's clear victory in the 2020 election.</p><p>During an interview with Fox Business host Maria Bartiromo, Navarro dismissed the election results, focusing on the allegations of voter fraud that President Donald Trump has leveled across several states.</p><p>\"We are moving forward here at the White House under the assumption there will be a second Trump term,\" he said. \"I think it's really important, before peoples' heads explode here, to understand that what we seek here is verifiable ballots, certifiable ballots and an investigation into what are growing numbers of allegations of fraud under signed affidavits by witnesses.\"</p><p>He added that in his \"own view looking at this election, we have what appears in some sense to be an immaculate deception.\"</p><p>Despite the claims from Navarro, Trump, and other leading Republicans, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/international-observers-say-no-voter-fraud-us-election-oas-2020-11\">there has been no verifiable evidence</a> of widespread voter fraud during the 2020 presidential election.</p><p>Trump still refuses to concede the election to Biden, instead <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-invalidate-election-results-lawsuits-differ-from-tweets-2020-11\">unleashing a series of tweets</a> filled with conspiracy theories and debunked claims of voter fraud.</p><p>In the days after the November 3 election, the Trump campaign <a href=\"https://time.com/5908505/trump-lawsuits-biden-wins/\">unleashed a litany of lawsuits</a> in Arizona, Nevada, Pennsylvania, and Michigan, seeking to either halt vote counting or throw out ballots. Many of the lawsuits <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-invalidate-election-results-lawsuits-differ-from-tweets-2020-11\">have already been dismissed</a> in court.</p><p>This past week, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/young-latino-educated-voters-helped-biden-flip-arizona-trump-election-2020-11\">Arizona was called for Biden</a> by Decision Desk HQ and Insider, moving Biden's Electoral College tally to 290, well past the 270 required for victory. Since he was declared president-elect, Biden has been meeting with Vice President-elect Kamala Harris to form his Cabinet and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-ron-klain-chief-of-staff-white-house-2020-11\">already named veteran Democratic advisor Ron Klain</a> as his incoming Chief of Staff.</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/_JA2NCxEmVw\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>During the interview, Navarro repeatedly questioned the credibility of the election results.</p><p>\"If you look statistically at this election, clearly the president won this election,\" he said. \"He was leading on Election Day, and then after Election Day, somehow, in these key battleground states, they got just enough votes to catch up to the president. That's what is being investigated.\"</p><p>Due to the coronavirus pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/03/democrats-more-mail-in-ballots-pennsylvania-433951\">Democrats utilized mail-in ballots at much higher rates than Republicans</a>, who overwhelmingly chose to vote on Election Day. In many states, mail-in ballots were not able to be counted until November 3 or in the days after, which often skewed the initial results to lean Republican.</p><p>Navarro insisted that Biden's plans to form his presidential administration shouldn't be validated.</p><p>\"We have a very clear set of election laws ... Our assumption is a second Trump term,\" Navarro said. \"Any speculation about what Joe Biden might do, I think, is moot at this point.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/biden-wins-presidency-trump-fox-news-projects\">Fox News has called the election</a> for Biden, as has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-kamala-harris-presidency-called-media-outlets-election-2020-11\">every major media outlet</a>. Biden flipped Arizona, Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin, all states that Trump won in 2016.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/peter-navarro-trump-white-house-ignoring-election-results-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9YziHdkTaCc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 15:08:49 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fafec631c741f0019ac9d81?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"286751afda3e5c824902a1f9432c9f99","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn31@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-39-678_5fd6cf1ac467723d.webp","destWidth":3494,"destHeight":2620,"sourceBytes":121104,"destBytes":121104,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fafedbc402d49001924efd7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn72@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-26-171_cf462efe1d629d04.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-37-664_6b77977c444db119.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn100@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-25-141_70aeec180b55f5e5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9YziHdkTaCc:CbGkNSCaXiU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn36@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-28-837_565a8a026016afa9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9YziHdkTaCc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-32-445_b77436ee0669e585.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991888},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"From 2023, Bacardi, Bombay Sapphire, and Grey Goose will be sold in biodegradable or paper-based bottles","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bacardi-launches-first-fully-biodegradable-spirits-bottle-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa969c91df1d50018219902?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bacardi\" height=\"3655\" width=\"4873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bacardi</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Bacardi is rolling out the world's first fully biodegradable spirits bottle, as well as paper bottles.</li>\n<li>Both bottle types will hit shelves in the US by 2023, and will be used for brands including Bombay Sapphire, Grey Goose, and Martini, alongside Bacardi rum.</li>\n<li>The new bottles can biodegrade within 18 months &#8211; and don't leave microplastics behind.</li>\n<li>\"This isn't about competetive advatange, it's about doing the right thing for our planet,\" says Bacardi's senior vice president for global operations.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Drinks maker Bacardi is rolling out the world's first fully biodegradable spirits bottle, which will hit shelves in the US by 2023.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It will be the world's most sustainable spirits bottle, the company says, and will replace 80 million plastic bottles totaling 3,000 tons of plastic each year.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Bermuda-based company will also launch paper drinks bottles.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Alongside its rum, Bacardi will use the bottles for the 200 other brands and labels it owns, including Bombay Sapphire gin, Grey Goose vodka, and Martini vermouth.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Regular plastic bottles take more than 400 years to decompose, but Bacardi's new bottles can biodegrade within 18 months – without leaving microplastics behind.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Bacardi will replace some of its petroleum-based bottles with ones made from Nodax PHA by biodegradable product manufacturer Danimer Scientific.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nodax PHA is a biopolymer that derives from the natural oils of plant seeds such as palm, canola, and soy. It can biodegrade in a range of environments, including compost, soil, freshwater, and sea water.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Danimer Scientific used the biopolymer in 2018 to create the world's first fully biodegradable plastic drinking straw.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-pepsico-is-choosing-energy-drinks-over-hard-seltzer-2020-10?r=gd-sub\">PepsiCo's CEO explains why it's shying away from hard seltzer even as Coca-Cola moves into booze</a></em></p><p>The new bottles feed into the drinks company's goal of being fully plastic-free by 2030.</p><p>As well as the Nodax PHA bottles, Bacardi is developing a paper bottle alternative made from sustainably-sourced trees.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Bacardi hasn't decided yet which drinks will be in the paper bottles and which will be in the biopolymer bottles, but said both bottle types will be launched in 2023.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The first drinks to be sold in the new bottles will be from Bacardi's rum range, including its 750ml Superior and Gold products and its 1.75L pre-mixed cocktails, Rodolfo Nervi, Bacardi's vice president for sustainability, told Business Insider.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After this, Bacardi will replace the 50ml plastic bottles used across its company's brands, before eventually replacing all the plastic bottles with a combination of paper and biopolymer bottles.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Priority will also be given to replacing the plastic closure liners, the thin layers of plastic used to seal the top of drinks bottles, as well as condiments and toiletries. Bacardi already uses these across its portfolio for bottles with a screw cap or crown cap. According to Nervi they add up to more than 600 tons of plastic annually.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\"It may sound small,\" said Jean-Marc Lambert, the company's senior vice president for global operations. \"But add that up across every bottle produced globally and we're talking many tonnes of plastic every day. Once we've fixed the problem, we'll be open sourcing the solution for the entire industry to use. This isn't about competitive advantage, it's about doing the right thing for the planet.'</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/bacardi-launches-first-fully-biodegradable-spirits-bottle-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a January","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/kayleigh-mcenany-trump-will-attend-his-own-inauguration-in-january-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafefa9402d49001924efda?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kayleigh McEnany\" height=\"2172\" width=\"4344\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany takes off her face covering before speaking with reporters outside the West Wing of the White House on October 2, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany claimed that President Trump will be \"attending his own inauguration\" in January 2021.&#160;</li>\n<li>In an interview with Fox News on Friday, McEnany said that she's confident the president's many legal challenges to contest the election results will eventually turn it around.</li>\n<li>\"I think the president will attend his own inauguration, he will have to be there in fact,\" McEnany said.</li>\n<li>McEnany has loyally stood by President Trump's side as he continues, without evidence, to dispute the election results.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany refused to acknowledge that President-elect Joe Biden will be sworn in as US president in January 2021, insisting instead that President Trump will attend \"his own inauguration.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/therecount/status/1327307548144398336\">Speaking to Fox Business on Friday, McEnany said </a>that she is confident President Trump's many legal challenges will eventually turn the election around, adding that the current administration only wants to \"lift the hood of the car\" on the results.</p><p>When asked by Fox Business host Stuart Varney whether Trump would attend the inauguration in January, McEnany responded: \"Again, that's many steps away here. We're talking January and President Trump believes he will be President Trump, have a second term, and litigation is the first step, many steps away from that.\"</p><p>But when Varney, who is usually a staunch Trump supporter, suggests that not attending the inauguration would \"look like sour grapes\", McEnany responded: \"I think the president will attend his own inauguration, he will have to be there in fact.\"</p><p>Watch the moment below:</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;The Recount  (@therecount) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1327307548144398336?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 13, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>McEnany has loyally stood by President Trump's side as he continues, without evidence, to dispute the election results, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-cut-trump-press-secretary-false-election-fraud-video-2020-11\">repeatedly calling them \"rigged.\"</a></p><p>Trump lost <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-wins-general-election-against-donald-trump-2020-11\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"db9e937179c6344916587c12fa8fa766\">the presidential election to President-elect Joe Biden&#160;</a>last week but has refused to concede, leading to some delays in the transition process.&#160;</p><p>No modern presidential candidate has ever refused to concede.&#160;</p><p>On Thursday, McEnany declined <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kayleigh-mcenany-refuses-answer-question-by-referring-it-to-herself-2020-11\">to answer a question on when Biden will receive access to intelligence briefings, telling \"Fox &#38; Friends\"</a>:&#160;\"That would be a question more for the White House.\"&#160;</p><p>Her comments led to confusion. McEnany has the title of the White House press secretary; however, she has also been serving as a Trump campaign adviser and surrogate.</p><p>McEnany herself has also continued to push unsubstantiated claims of voter fraud in the 2020 election.</p><p>Earlier this week, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-cut-trump-press-secretary-false-election-fraud-video-2020-11\">Fox News cut off the press secretary's press conference</a> in which she baselessly suggested that the Democrats welcomed \"fraud\" and \"illegal voting\" into the election.</p><p>\"Unless she has more details to back that up, I can't in good countenance continue to show you this,\" the Fox News anchor Neil Cavuto said at the time, as he cut off the press conference.</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kayleigh-mcenany-vowed-never-lie-first-white-house-press-briefing-2020-5\">Trump's new White House press secretary vowed to 'never lie' in first official briefing</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kayleigh-mcenany-biden-white-house-celebration-a-superspreader-event-2020-11\">Trump's press secretary Kayleigh McEnany called White House celebrations by Biden supporters a 'superspreader' event</a><br><section></section></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-cut-trump-press-secretary-false-election-fraud-video-2020-11\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Fox News cut away from Trump's press secretary as she pushed baseless claims of election fraud</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-is-kayleigh-mcenany-bio-life-facts-trump-rnc-cnn-2017-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Meet Kayleigh McEnany, the combative 31-year-old Trump defender and next White House press secretary</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/kayleigh-mcenany-trump-will-attend-his-own-inauguration-in-january-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div Ankel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fafefa9402d49001924efda?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn35@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-27-788_a6f5ccf9c5506614.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CGqLoskxca0:k1GVqAUnhF0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn75@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-31-310_71f518c9dee00b99.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CGqLoskxca0:k1GVqAUnhF0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn39@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-28-012_f57c5181d74cd325.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CGqLoskxca0:k1GVqAUnhF0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn50@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-35-535_093a2bb656c260ed.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/CGqLoskxca0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn68@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-38-646_d846f36ba84534ed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991911},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"A billionaire couple is behind the historic coronavirus vaccine","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/a-billionaire-couple-is-behind-the-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faaedc0f7d1cb0019e3aee8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ugur Sahin Özlem Türeci biontech\" height=\"2613\" width=\"3490\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dr. Ugur Sahin and Dr. Özlem Türeci.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stefan F. SoÂ¤mmer via www.imago-images.de/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A scientist power-couple is a driving force behind Pfizer's new coronavirus vaccine.</li>\n<li>Dr. Ugur Sahin is the CEO and Dr. &#214;zlem T&#252;reci the chief medical officer of BioNTech, the company that created the vaccine in partnership with Pfizer.</li>\n<li>Business Insider took a deep dive into who they are, and how they've made their mark on modern medicine.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Pfizer's new coronavirus vaccine — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\">which boasts at least a 90% efficacy</a> in early trials — made history as the fastest vaccine ever developed.&#160;</p><p>The vaccine was developed in partnership with German company BioNTech, a company cofounded by a Turkish-German married couple who became billionaires months ago, when the pact with Pfizer was announced. But after this week, the CEO, Dr. Ugur Sahin, and the chief medical officer, Dr. Özlem Türeci, saw their joint fortune skyrocket.</p><p>The vaccine-power couple met while working at a university hospital in southwest Germany; they are both German citizens of Turkish origins (Sahin moved with his family to Germany when he was 4 years old).</p><p>Sahin is the son of car factory workers, and developed his love of science and research by reading science books. Türeci grew up watching her surgeon father operate on patients.&#160;</p><p>Business Insider took a deep dive into the couple that may just help us get to the other side of this pandemic.&#160;</p><section data-track-content=\"\" data-post-type=\"post\"><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/meet-married-biontech-billionaires-who-helped-create-pfizer-vaccine-2020-11?r=biontechbillionaires-teaser\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"1494d32cfbf4b250c9bd60ab7efa9b8a\">Subscribe to Business Insider to read the full story.</a></h2></section><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/a-billionaire-couple-is-behind-the-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ZjJNuPWYaF0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 13:30:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5faaee5bf7d1cb0019e3aef7?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"42ead0e805efa8b5797f1779e73210ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn9@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-40-484_c5ea4ef87a5f36d3.webp","destWidth":3478,"destHeight":2609,"sourceBytes":680330,"destBytes":680330,"author":"insider@insider.com (Juliana Kaplan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5faaedc0f7d1cb0019e3aee8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn43@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-25-200_f356a6c211300aa9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn55@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-28-129_c233cf92a69c1fcb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn61@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-37-035_44738a113e2030a7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZjJNuPWYaF0:Rmha0t0qX6w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn24@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-25-108_7e8609ad4f623a0d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ZjJNuPWYaF0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn27@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-26-391_dc91c9ea7deecdfe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991863},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Meet the millennial cofounder of a jewelry brand that has partnered with the NFL and NBA and is on track to make $50 million in revenue this year","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/millennial-jewelry-exec-cofounder-gld-on-track-to-hit-50-million-in-sales-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadccd21e8d50001981346c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Christian Johntson GLD\" height=\"545\" width=\"727\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Christian Johnston.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johntson cofounder of GLD</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Christian Johnston, 28, is the cofounder of <a href=\"https://www.thegldshop.com/pages/about-gld\">GLD</a>, which is known for making diamond jewelry that can range in price from $899 to over $40,000.&#160;</li>\n<li>The company has <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/shopgld/?hl=en\">an elite client list</a> that includes the Kardashians, rapper Cardi B, and singer Justin Bieber. It has also struck deals to create jewelry for the NFL, NBA, MLB, and Marvel.&#160;</li>\n<li>This year, the company is on track to do over $50 million in revenue, per documents reviewed by Business Insider.&#160;</li>\n<li>In an interview, Johnston talks about why he decided to make affordable diamonds for the aspirational consumer.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Each year, jewelry brand <a href=\"https://www.thegldshop.com/pages/about-gld\">GLD</a> pulls into Rolling Loud, one of the world's largest hip-hop festivals, in a refurbished ice cream truck. The goal: to sell pendants and watches to festival-goers. The mantra: to just have a good time.&#160;</p><p>\"We just drive it around blasting music,\" Christian Johnston, GLD cofounder told Business Insider. \"It creates a good atmosphere.\"&#160;</p><p>It's just what's expected, perhaps, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/shopgld/?hl=en\">of the popular jewelry brand</a>, whose elite client roster includes Justin Bieber, Cardi B, Russell Westbrook, and Kevin Durant.</p><p>The brand is cool enough to snag partnership with the NFL, the NBA, the MLB, and Marvel, creating pendants designed as superheroes, and with basketball, football, and baseball team logos.&#160;</p><p>Johnston, 28, cofounded GLD alongside his childhood friend, Dan Folger, 27, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, in 2015. Growing up, Johnston told Business Insider, they both always wanted to have nice jewelry, but never had the option to buy any for an affordable price.&#160;</p><p>\"You either had to spend thousands of dollars or you were getting something that was not so nice and you couldn't really be proud of,\" Johnston said. \"To me, you should always be proud of your jewelry if you're going to have it.\"&#160;</p><p>Each put just under $1,000 into the idea of making high-quality jewelry at a lower price point and the concept was a hit.</p><p>Five years later, the company is on track to do $50 million in revenue before the end of this year, per documents reviewed by Business Insider.&#160;</p><p>\"It was once a joke that everything we had we put into a cardboard box — our whole business could fit into a box,\" Johnston said. \"Then the box got a little bigger, and a little bigger, and then before we knew it, we had our first office in Pittsburgh.\"&#160;</p><h2>Johnston credits Instagram for helping the brand grow</h2><p>GLD, a play on the word \"gold,\" seeks to create affordable jewelry for the aspirational customer. A Rolex, for example can go anywhere from $5,000 to above $12,000. The lowest-priced — and best-selling — GLD watch goes for $899.</p><p>It's a watch that is fully covered in diamonds — a process known as \"icing.\" It is offered in either 18-carat plated gold or 14-carat solid gold, with the dial options of either white, red, and black. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadcbab1e8d500019813468?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Christian Johntson GLD\" height=\"3000\" width=\"2417\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johnston cofounder of GLD</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Watches take a long time to produce, Johnston said, but GLD aims to create products that can compete with the Rolexes and the Audemars Piguets that the average consumer is priced out of buying. This means paying close attention to how the band, case, bezel, movements, and dials come together.&#160;</p><p>Johnston said he is also particular about the types of diamonds he uses, making sure to source from a dealer that allows him to track each diamond's origin.&#160;</p><p>One of GLD's first celebrity clients and supporters was Pittsburgh native Wiz Khalifa, who Johnson met through his manager back when Khalifa was just starting out in the rap game, he said. The company has since been able to expand its brand to heavy-hitter clients such as Justin Bieber and Cardi B.&#160;</p><p>Johnston credits GLD's Instagram presence for its brand growth, saying that GLD stayed consistent in posting content that showcased the brand and its products. The aesthetic of the brand is streetwear, glitz, and new money glamour, so its Instagram has photos that show <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CFOIaQNHqJb/\">rapper Rick Ross decked out in GLD diamond chains</a> and a GLD watch <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEx2t5kHf7p/\">wrapped around a bottle of Veuve Clicquot</a> champagne.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadcbab1e8d500019813467?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Christian Johntson GLD\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johnston cofounder of GLD</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>GLD currently has just over 1 million followers on Instagram, and many clients, like Bieber, make requests through the social platform's direct messaging service.</p><p>Outside of social media, GLD has also fielded custom requests from country duo Florida Georgia Line and the Kardashians.&#160; Sometimes when big-name clients come to GLD, Johnston said, they request jewelry pieces on a tight deadline, sometimes two weeks or less.&#160;</p><p>When that happens, he said,&#160;\"We literally have to work day and night to get the sketches down and get the 3D cast done. And then hurry up and get it printed and then get it cast and then hurry up and get the diamond set.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadcba94652d40019744250?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Christian Johntson GLD\" height=\"2062\" width=\"2197\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trippie Redd custom choker.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johnston cofounder of GLD</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Those are extreme circumstances, however. Johnston said it typically takes them about a month to create each piece. One of the company's most memorable requests came from rapper Trippie Redd, who asked for a diamond choker necklace that fit perfectly around his neck. The choker is valued at around $100,000.&#160;</p><p>\"It was a skull that was bending backwards and the eyes lit up,\" Johnston continued. \"There was an on-and-off switch and the eyes had neon lights in them. [Redd] wears jewelry everywhere, so we had to make it waterproof.\"</p><h2>'You ice something out completely, you do risk potentially losing some value'&#160;</h2><p>Though GLD is known for making iced-out jewelry, Johnston acknowledged the risk of icing out a product too much.</p><p>Business Insider has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wealthy-people-buying-luxury-watches-as-they-shift-from-stocks-2020-4\">previously reported on how watches</a> such as Rolex, Philippe Patek Audemars Piguet, Richard Milles are typically seen as an investable asset class that retains its value over time. These watches are often made in styles that are seen to be classic and timeless.&#160;&#160;</p><p>But there's no telling how much an iced-out Richard Mille will go for in 20 years.</p><p>\"In general, you ice something out completely, you do risk potentially losing some value,\" Johnston says, adding that the investment value of a watch is tied to what's trending among consumers.&#160;</p><p>\"If you do it right, it will keep the value,\" Johnston continued. \"You have to make sure you're putting the right diamonds on to keep with the value of the watch and have the diamond paperwork to back it all up.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadd5291e8d500019813471?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Christian Johntson GLD\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Up close of the Trippie Redd choker.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johnson cofounder of GLD</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Right now, the demand for iced-out diamonds has propelled GLD to popularity. Three years ago, the company relocated from Pittsburgh to Miami, and amid the pandemic, the company moved to an even larger space, doubling its team to 55 employees.</p><p>\"We were really back-and-forth between Miami and LA,\" he says. \"[In] Miami, we felt like there's more of an opportunity down here to create something new. LA has a lot more history with streetwear, but in Miami, there's more of an opportunity for us to really make a name for ourselves and take over.\"&#160;</p><p>Johnston said the coronavirus pandemic hasn't financially affected the company and credits its strong brand identity and loyal customer base with putting it on pace to reach $50 million in sales this year.</p><p>\"There were definitely challenges that came from it on the back end,\" Johnston said. \"Just in terms of keeping people safe, and my operations and things like that. But in terms of sales, we've had a great year. We didn't have to lay off any people.\"&#160;</p><p>During this time, the company has been focusing on its partnerships. In 2019, GLD entered into a partnership with both the National Basketball Association and Disney's Marvel, the latter of which has yet to be released. This year, GLD formalized its partnership with the NFL and released its collaboration with the MLB.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadd79a4652d40019744261?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GLD Christian Johnston\" height=\"1632\" width=\"3264\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The piece GLD made for Kevin Durant\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Christian Johnston</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>It's a testament to taking one's time, Johnston said. It took him five years to exceed 1 million followers on Instagram, he said — a piece of cake compared to what it took to formalize its partnership with the NBA.&#160;</p><p>\"There's a lot of things you gotta do to become eligible to work with the NBA,\" he says. \"They're very specific with who they work with.\"</p><p>He said there was not only a lot of&#160;paperwork, but associates from the NBA came to GLD to inspect its factories and its full behind-the-scenes process of how makes jewelry.&#160;</p><p>\"Luckily we, from the beginning, always made it a point to do things the right way,\" he said. \"I think that's made it a lot easier.\"&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/millennial-jewelry-exec-cofounder-gld-on-track-to-hit-50-million-in-sales-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aU64Z4ZOQjY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 13:55:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fadcbed4652d40019744258?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"03a1aab8477db5de9250393fb3a526e8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn98@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-40-464_8c54a1babe1422bf.webp","destWidth":1019,"destHeight":766,"sourceBytes":74466,"destBytes":74466,"author":"ddavis@businessinsider.com (Dominic-Madori Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fadccd21e8d50001981346c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn19@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-27-789_219523e1ba640e84.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fadcbab1e8d500019813468?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn90@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-33-722_e04a0abb8e723d1b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fadcbab1e8d500019813467?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn48@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-36-177_f0966509e36367a0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fadcba94652d40019744250?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn3@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-867_69e86964e575bedf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fadd5291e8d500019813471?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-27-040_54bf2a97ee35abe3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fadd79a4652d40019744261?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn65@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-34-766_9b33ae31a214e9ee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-34-424_380249fb8d56642b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn77@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-37-288_ea17a0d51ecf3924.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aU64Z4ZOQjY:uHxsJPY2JXE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn64@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-32-245_a84ddc063cb7dd97.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aU64Z4ZOQjY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn8@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-24-982_18ce1995a2e333cb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991897},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"The racial wealth gap in real estate is growing. Here are 3 ways housing has been harder for Black Americans in 2020.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/race-real-estate-wealth-gap-housing-redfin-black-americans-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac57a998669500182b57f8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"housing keys real estate\" height=\"3840\" width=\"5119\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Black Americans pay higher mortgage interest rates on lower-value homes than white Americans, new studies find.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Prostock-Studio/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The racial wealth gap in real estate between Black and white Americans seems to be worsening, according to two new studies and a recently filed lawsuit.</li>\n<li>On average, Black families pay over $60,000 more in lifetime homeownership costs than white families, according to MIT researchers.</li>\n<li>Meanwhile, their homes don't receive valuations as high as white homeowners' properties do, per an Oxford University Press report.&#160;</li>\n<li>The challenges Black Americans face in the real estate market are underscored by a recent lawsuit against Redfin that claims the popular brokerage's pricing policies discriminate against minority sellers and buyers.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The coronavirus pandemic ushered in record-low mortgage interest rates that sparked <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-2020-broke-the-housing-market-inventory-could-run-out-2020-9\">a buying frenzy</a> and sent the US barreling toward a housing shortage.</p><p>And while it could seem like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/challenges-home-buying-during-pandemic-2020-6\">everyone is buying a house in 2020</a>, real estate purchases have proven to be more difficult for one demographic in particular: Black Americans.</p><p>The national homeownership rate for Black families is 44%, while it is 73.7% for white families. The difference is significant, especially when considering that home ownership is a major form of household wealth accumulation in the US, in addition to stocks and high wages.</p><p>Black families, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/charts-black-americans-gaping-economic-inequality-white-unemployment-earnings-financial-2020-6#the-household-wealth-of-white-americans-is-17x-higher-than-that-of-black-americans-3\">as Business Insider's&#160; </a><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/joseph-zeballos-roig\" data-e2e-name=\"byline-author-name\" data-uri=\"3ad476f2683d6858eb10c2651f3fc697\">Joseph Zeballos-Roig</a><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/charts-black-americans-gaping-economic-inequality-white-unemployment-earnings-financial-2020-6#the-household-wealth-of-white-americans-is-17x-higher-than-that-of-black-americans-3\"> and Madison Hoff reported</a>, \"lack easy access to these levers of prosperity, and it's a hurdle to building wealth over generations.\"</p><p>The racial wealth gap in real estate has a long and insidious history, as the practice of \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-redlining-kept-black-americans-from-homeownership-and-still-does-2020-6\">redlining</a>\" was a major factor in the white middle class building home equity during the 20th century — while the Black middle class largely missed out.&#160;</p><p>And the gap just keeps growing, based off reports and lawsuits using data from the present day that show Black homeowners pay more, get lower appraisals, and may still be facing discrimination in the real-estate market.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Black homeowners pay higher costs</strong></h2><p><a href=\"http://gcfp.mit.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Mortgage-Cost-for-Black-Homeowners-10.1.pdf\">An October study</a> from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology found that, on average, Black Americans pay out more while they are homeowners than white Americans do.</p><p>The study found that Black Americans pay $743 more per year in mortgage interest payments, $550 more in mortgage insurance premiums, and $390 more in property taxes. The researchers calculated that Black families will spend $13,464 more than white families over the life of a home loan, which they estimated ultimately amounts to $67,320 in \"lost retirement savings for Black homeowners.\"</p><p>MIT's Edward L. Golding, Michelle Aronowitz, and Jung Hyun Choi labeled it \"the Black tax.\"</p><p>\"The average Black family has about $130,000 less in savings at the time of retirement than the average white family,\" Golding, who is also the executive director of the MIT Golub Center for Finance and Policy, told <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2020-10-22/black-americans-pay-more-to-be-homeowners-than-other-groups-mit-video\">Bloomberg</a>. \"About half of that disparity can be directly attributed to the higher cost that they're paying on homeownership.\"</p><p>The difference is more than enough to keep minorities priced out of the housing market, which, to compound matters for Black Americans seeking to buy, has only <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-home-prices-rise-august-inventory-pandemic-2020-10\">gotten more expensive</a> throughout the pandemic year of 2020.</p><h2><strong>Black-owned homes are appraised at lower values</strong></h2><p>Even today, the racial makeup of a neighborhood can dictate its homes' value.</p><p>In 2015, the difference between the average home value in a predominantly white neighborhood and a predominantly Black neighborhood was $164,000, according to a September <a href=\"https://academic.oup.com/socpro/advance-article-abstract/doi/10.1093/socpro/spaa033/5900507?redirectedFrom=fulltext\">Oxford University Press study</a>. In 1980, it was $86,000.&#160;</p><p>The researchers said this widening gap could be attributed to appraisers using the \"sales comparison approach\" to valuing homes. This strategy, based off previously sold properties nearby, can result in appraisers valuing homes based on pricing that was determined prior to the implementation and enforcement of fair housing laws in the 1960s and 1970s. By using neighboring properties as benchmarks — whose prices may have been depressed for decades — appraisers today \"literally baked into the system the racialized element and continued it,\" said Junia Howell, one of the authors on the study.</p><p>The National Association of Realtors' director of fair housing policy, Bryan Green, told <a href=\"https://grow.acorns.com/how-race-affects-home-values-ownership/\">CNBC</a> that even when appraisers try to stay unbiased, they still use \"market conditions\" to estimate home values. But those very conditions may well have been shaped by the pervasive practice of lower prices in minority neighborhoods.</p><p>\"If race is baked into market conditions, everyone can disavow blame for a big problem,\" Green said. \"Everyone can say they are innocent, but there remains a big systematic problem.\"</p><p>The study noted that minority communities have built less wealth than white communities over the last 50 years as a direct result of the disparity in home appraisals.</p><h2><strong>A lawsuit alleges Redfin discriminates against Black home sellers</strong></h2><p>On top of paying more to own homes and having their homes valued at a lower prices, Black Americans could also struggle with discriminatory real estate practices.</p><p>On October 29, the National Fair Housing Alliance (NFHA) <a href=\"https://nationalfairhousing.org/2020/10/29/nfha-files-federal-discrimination-lawsuit-to-stop-redfins-real-estate-redlining/\">filed a lawsuit</a> against Redfin, the popular real estate brokerage. The lawsuit alleges that the company \"discriminates against sellers and buyers of homes in communities of color in many metropolitan areas.\"</p><p>The lawsuit hinges on Redfin's minimum home price policy, which requires that properties be listed at a specific minimum price that varies from market to market. Certain services, like agent assistance and virtual tours, are only available for listings above that minimum.</p><p>Listings in Chicago, for example, have to exceed a $400,000 listing minimum for sellers and realtors to receive those supplemental services. The city's population is 30.1 percent Black, according to <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/chicagocityillinois\">census data</a>. Meanwhile, listings in the next county over, DuPage County — which <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/dupagecountyillinois\">census statistics</a> record as 5.6% Black — have a $275,000 listing minimum, according to the <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/11/02/housing-groups-sue-redfin-alleging-federal-discrimination-violations/\">Washington Post.</a> The difference in the minimum prices effectively \"restricted access to services and financial incentives for sellers and buyers of homes in predominantly non-white areas.\"</p><p>In addition to Chicago, the NFHA's two-year investigation found that \"Redfin offers no services in non-white ZIP codes at a disproportionately higher rate than in white ZIP codes\" in and around Baltimore, Detroit, Kansas City, Memphis, Milwaukee, Philadelphia, Long Island, and Newark. The lawsuit's plaintiffs called the practice a form of \"digital redlining,\" referencing <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-redlining-kept-black-americans-from-homeownership-and-still-does-2020-6\">the 1930s housing practice</a> of what the Dept. of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) describes as \"denying credit to residents of predominantly minority neighborhoods.\"</p><p>\"Redfin's policies redline communities of color and will further exacerbate the racial wealth and homeownership gaps,\" the president of the NFHA, Lisa Rice, said in a statement. \"We must ensure that all neighborhoods are treated fairly and have access to the full range of services provided by real estate companies.\"</p><p>Redfin CEO Glenn Kelman posted <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/news/redfin-and-fair-housing/\">a statement</a> on the company's website in response to the lawsuit saying the company abides by the federal laws of the Fair Housing Act. \"The challenge,\" he wrote, \"is that we don't know how to sell the lowest-priced homes while paying our agents and other staff a living wage, with health insurance and other benefits.\"</p><p>Some changes could be on the horizon. Kelman pledged to \"expand into lower-priced communities ... faster,\" while the <a href=\"https://www.inman.com/2020/11/11/nar-considers-local-mandates-for-fair-housing-diversity-and-equity/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+inmannews+%28Inman+News+-+Headlines%29lines%29\">National Association of Realtors</a> just said it is considering requiring diversity, equity, and inclusion and fair housing components into their strategic plans and leadership trainings.&#160;</p><p>Experts like Green and Golding, however, say that sizable change will only come with new, equitable policies or further regulation at the local, state, and federal levels.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/race-real-estate-wealth-gap-housing-redfin-black-americans-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
