border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=KK8sNJmrxcU:Wi8WIukdTe8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KK8sNJmrxcU:Wi8WIukdTe8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KK8sNJmrxcU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 17:06:05 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fa18f5069331a0011bc6fdc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"4eee500dc8599146d6cd4d3e39de923f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn85@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-40-957_bc700eb76bd5dcf1.webp","destWidth":5333,"destHeight":4000,"sourceBytes":1874788,"destBytes":1874788,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa18f361df1d5001821891e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-26-988_1cd0930ea3b80a6b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faf2dfb402d49001924efac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn83@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-28-530_06f69cf07e201cca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KK8sNJmrxcU:Wi8WIukdTe8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn83@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-26-890_4f000804124704b1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KK8sNJmrxcU:Wi8WIukdTe8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn48@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-26-893_01159ab676fab7f9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=KK8sNJmrxcU:Wi8WIukdTe8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-30-600_fbc800f785c4cfdf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KK8sNJmrxcU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn84@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-36-541_120f7c5cfc0387b7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991910},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Ant's crown jewel, Alipay, is a supercharged version of popular American apps like Venmo and PayPal. Here's everything you need to know about the app used by more than 1 billion Chinese residents.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-alipay-ant-group-fintech-app-china","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faeb12d1c741f0019ac9a65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"alipay ant group\" height=\"1082\" width=\"1442\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The app for Alipay, the mobile payments service operated by Ant Group, is seen on a smartphone in Beijing on Monday, July 20, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ng Han Guan/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Ant Group, the giant Chinese fintech company, was ready to embark on a historic IPO when China intervened and shockingly ground the event to a halt, a move that was reportedly issued directly by President Xi Jinping.</li>\n<li>The firm's prized app, Alipay, is used by over 1 billion Chinese residents and is like a \"combination of some of the most popular American apps,\" one expert said, allowing people to make payments, get a credit card, buy insurance, and even hail a taxi.</li>\n<li>Americans can't use Alipay without a Chinese bank account, but if it were widely adopted in the US, think of it as a way to handle financial milestones across your lifetime, from opening your first checking account to purchasing car insurance.</li>\n<li>\"There's no Progressive or Geico,\" Blair Silverberg told Business Insider. \"None of the 30-plus stops that you stopped at along the way of your financial life. You don't make any of those, it all happens through the app.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>All eyes were on the Chinese financial technology company Ant Group last week as it was gearing up for the world's largest IPO until it was abruptly suspended.</p><p>According to a <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-president-xi-jinping-halted-jack-ma-ant-ipo-11605203556\">Wall Street Journal</a> report Thursday, China's President Xi Jinping had direct input in grinding the IPO to a halt in what has become a major sign of China's ability to disrupt the plans of even one of the nation's largest private companies.</p><p>Its IPO debacle aside, Ant is obviously still a big deal — and it largely has its crown jewel to thank for that: an app called Alipay.</p><p>Alipay was originally an escrow payment service for Alibaba, Jack Ma's ecommerce leviathan that some have called the \"Amazon of China.\" It was eventually spun out and has transformed into a giant in its own right. It's also still the only way customers can check out on Alibaba's retail sites, Taobao and Tmall.</p><p>More than 1 billion Chinese citizens use the company's services, rendering Ant a large aspect of China's financial system and \"critical to consumers every day,\" Matthew Schopfer, head of research at the investment firm Infusive Asset Management, told Business Insider.&#160;</p><p>\"It's like imagining a combination of some of the most popular American apps, all strung together in a seamlessly integrated way but with finance tied to it,\" Eric Schiffer, CEO of private equity firm The Patriarch Organization, told Business Insider.</p><p>There's a Venmo-like payment feature that lets you send money to people and a PayPal-style service for making online payments. It lets you store money in a checking account, buy and manage insurance, receive financing, get a credit card, and even hail a taxi. You can also use the app to pay the bill at restaurants and other participating businesses by simply scanning a QR code, a feat that has bolstered Alipay's widespread adoption in China.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faeb1191c741f0019ac9a61?format=jpeg\" alt=\"alipay app china ant\" height=\"1331\" width=\"1780\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Alipay (L) and Wechat (R) QR payment codes are displayed at a market in Shanghai on October 27, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">HECTOR RETAMAL/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Imagine it as a do-everything app that you can use to manage financial milestones from adolescence into retirement. Your parents could give you an allowance through the app, you could get your first credit card through it, buy a car, and pick auto insurance.</p><p>\"There's no Progressive or Geico,\" Capital CEO and cofounder Blair Silverberg told Business Insider. \"None of the 30-plus stops that you stopped at along the way of your financial life — you don't make any of those, it all happens through the app.\"</p><p>Hundreds of millions of Chinese citizens don't use what you would think of as a traditional financial service or even have a credit card, and Ant Group has met them more than halfway.</p><p>The online financial world as it currently stands can be \"a totally fragmented universe,\" Silverberg said. \"And if that were all in one place, like the button on your phone, that's kind of what Ant Financial has created.\"</p><p>Alipay also makes it easier for more people to obtain credit thanks to its algorithm, which can qualify people who wouldn't normally be qualified based upon traditional creditworthiness risk profile, Schiffer said. And consumers are going to gravitate toward services that can more easily provide them with financial opportunities without going through hoops.</p><p>\"The smart fintechs of the future, and Ant being one, will be proactive in how they look at not only democratizing credit profiles but also providing opportunities to funding,\" Schiffer said.&#160;</p><p>Alipay is not ingrained in American consumer culture as it is in China — Americans can't use Alipay without a Chinese bank account, and the Trump administration has reportedly floated a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-tencent-ant-group-restricting-chinese-firms-2020-10\">ban</a> on the company as it continues to crack down on Chinese apps and services, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-ban-injunction-court-hearing-after-election-day-donald-trump-2020-10\">TikTok</a>.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-jack-mas-ant-group-went-from-business-disrupter-to-chinese-tech-champion-11595335267?mod=business_lead_pos13\">The Wall Street Journal</a> has reported that Ant Group had always intended to skip over the New York Stock Exchange and only file to go public in Shanghai and Hong Kong. But US-China relations have grown increasingly strained in recent months, a fact that Schiffer said likely did play a role in Ant's decision.</p><p>\"I think they wanted to be careful to not become the enemy of regulators by flaunting the massive raise on US soil,\" Schiffer said.</p><p>But as Ant's IPO plans stand now, they may not resume for another six months in China. And even when they do, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-happened-ant-group-ipo-jack-ma-alipay-2020-11\">Ant will likely not list as the fintech disruptor it was predicted to be</a>. Instead, the company will likely rely more heavily on conservative banking methodology to comply with China's new regulations on microlending.</p><p>\"The pure-play fintech is out the window — that's dead and buried,\" Schiffer said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-alipay-ant-group-fintech-app-china'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=76qXHXRjqB0:T2FyFpmQW1Y:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img like","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-what-a-post-election-trump-tower-might-look-like-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f749a0274fe5b0018a8e339?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump tower\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A guard stands outside of Trump Tower on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan on August 24, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a Platt/Getty</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump lost his bid for reelection, making him the eleventh incumbent president to do so.</li>\n<li>But at New York City's Trump Tower, the future may be a bit brighter.</li>\n<li>Prices and desirability at the tower decreased during Trump's presidency, but brokers tell Business Insider that now they're \"optimistic.\"</li>\n<li>A resident says it was \"terrible\" in the building when Trump began his political rise.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>It's a new day in New York City's Trump Tower.</p><p>Sandra Arnold, who lives in Chicago but has owned an apartment there for over 20 years, said that when President Donald Trump's political star began to rise, it was \"terrible\" in the building.</p><p>\"I really did think that I want to move and sell the property, but I love New York so much,\" she told Business Insider.</p><p>Business Insider spoke to former and current apartment owners — and brokers representing units for sale — to see what they think the future of the tower holds.&#160;The tower had seen prices and desirability decrease during Trump's presidency.</p><p>Now Realtors are optimistic, especially since the extensive security may ease if Trump permanently relocates to Florida.&#160;</p><section data-track-content=\"\" data-post-type=\"post\"><h2><a 2020 14:45:00 (Juliana Kaplan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f749a0274fe5b0018a8e339?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-30-233_396c26850cf68ced.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Sglyq4Vparo:DQOnkO_kv9U:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn16@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-30-919_5c0e66d8bbb27d39.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Sglyq4Vparo:DQOnkO_kv9U:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn44@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-37-820_a66c284a68a357fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Sglyq4Vparo:DQOnkO_kv9U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-35-444_371945f3752cf17b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Sglyq4Vparo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn11@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-31-737_2fbca3fc79340e93.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991853},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Italy extended the regions on its 'red zone' list after breaking its record for the highest number of new daily COVID-19 infections","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/italy-red-zone-broke-record-highest-daily-covid-19-infections-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fafe8461c741f0019ac9d7f?format=jpeg\" alt=\" italy hospital staff\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Healthcare workers assist suspected COVID-19 patients outside a hospital in Naples.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Salvatore Laporta/KONTROLAB/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Italy is facing the prospect of another potential lockdown after the country recorded 40,902 new COVID-19 infections and 550 deaths on Friday, according to reports.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-54937699\">BBC News</a> reports that Campania and Tuscany will be added to the country's \"red zone\" list for high-risk regions.&#160;</li>\n<li>Residents in these regions will join Lombardy, Bolzano, Piedmont, Aosta Valley, and Calabria, which have all been issued with a stay-at-home order.</li>\n<li>The Italian government's COVID-19 consultant, Walter Ricciardi, told reporters Italy has \"two to three weeks to decide whether to impose a new national lockdown,\" <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-54937699\">the BBC reports.</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Italy is preparing to add Campania and Tuscany to its list of high-risk \"red zone\" regions as the country faces the prospect of another national lockdown, according to <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-54937699\">BBC News.</a></p><p>From Sunday, residents in these regions will face a stay at home order and will not be allowed to leave unless for health reasons, essential shopping, or for emergencies, the publication reports. They will join Lombardy, Bolzano, Piedmont, Aosta Valley, and Calabria, which are all on the country's high-risk&#160; list.</p><p>The government's COVID-19 consultant, Walter Ricciardi, told reporters that Italy has \"two to three weeks to decide whether to impose a new national lockdown,\" <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-54937699\">the BBC reports.</a></p><p>This comes as the country recorded 40,902 new COVID-19 cases – its highest number of new daily infections – on Friday, according to the publication.&#160;</p><p>There were a further 550 new deaths recorded in the same 24-hour period, <a href=\"https://www.thelocal.it/20201113/covid-19-italy-set-to-declare-more-regions-orange-and-red-zones\">The Local reports</a>.</p><p>Earlier this week, healthcare staff outside Cotugno hospital, a specialist infectious disease hospital in Naples, were <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/covid-19-naples-cotugno-hospital-gives-oxygen-people-outside-cars-2020-11?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">filmed giving oxygen to waiting COVID-19 patients</a> in their cars.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Irish Times Video  (@irishtimesvideo) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1326073425228607489?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 10, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>In October, there were violent mass protests against new lockdown restrictions. The police arrested dozens of demonstrators in cities including Rome, Turin, Milan, and Naples, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/italy-coronavirus-lockdown-protests-fires-looting-2020-10\">Business Insider's Bill Bostock previously reported.</a></p><p>One <a href=\"https://twitter.com/CaterinaRossi0/status/1320870955904892928?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1320870955904892928%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fitaly-coronavirus-lockdown-protests-fires-looting-2020-100-10\">video posted on Twitter</a> showed a group of people looting a Gucci store in Turin.&#160;</p><p>The regions in the country's \"orange zone\" (medium-high risk) include: Abruzzo, Basilicata, Liguria, Puglia, Sicily, Marche, Umbria, Emilia-Romagna, and Friuli-Venezia Giulia, according to <a href=\"https://www.thelocal.it/20201113/covid-19-italy-set-to-declare-more-regions-orange-and-red-zones\">The Local.</a></p><p>Lazio, Molise, Sardinia, and Veneto are in the \"yellow zone\" (moderate risk), the publication adds.</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/covid-19-naples-cotugno-hospital-gives-oxygen-people-outside-cars-2020-11?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">A hard-pressed Italian hospital resorted to giving oxygen to COVID-19 patients in their cars outside</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/italy-coronavirus-lockdown-protests-fires-looting-2020-10\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">People across Italy violently protested new lockdown measures imposed after a spike in COVID-19 cases, setting fires and looting luxury stores</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/enlisted-sailors-aboard-navy-aircraft-carriers-higher-covid-19-risk-2020-11\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Enlisted sailors aboard the Navy's aircraft carriers are at higher risk for COVID-19, new study shows</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/asian-american-businesses-covid-19-racism-coronavirus-restaurants-economy-2020-10\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Asian American businesses are facing racist obstacles driven by the COVID-19 pandemic. They need our support.</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 15:38:49 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fafe853402d49001924efd4?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"80af6fb06c9bc45ff04fb589170abc21","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn3@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-39-737_4ce232e00d6a8bc0.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":88820,"destBytes":88820,"author":"mfriel@businessinsider.com (Mikhaila Friel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fafe8461c741f0019ac9d7f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn100@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-26-920_8598992290d0b33d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DiM4Rf2SpGw:TjJXHU14aRw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn17@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-36-935_a2c16f1e6958b9ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DiM4Rf2SpGw:TjJXHU14aRw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn11@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-29-789_2374af3d0a1728d8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DiM4Rf2SpGw:TjJXHU14aRw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn99@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-38-714_923711fc80096bba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/DiM4Rf2SpGw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn81@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-34-566_947afd2bf759ccdb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991833},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Trump urges Congress to pass a 'big and focused' coronavirus relief bill in 1st stimulus comments since losing the election","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-congress-big-focused-coronavirus-relief-bill-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd1b5f7d1cb0019e3b0b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump pentagon\" height=\"2736\" width=\"5472\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Trump pressed Congress to pass another stimulus bill in a tweet on Saturday.</li>\n<li>\"Congress must now do a Covid Relief Bill. Needs Democrats support,\" he <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1327633164823617548?s=20\">wrote on Twitter.</a> \"Make it big and focused. Get it done!\"</li>\n<li>His comments were unlikely to break the stalemate on Capitol Hill among Democrats and Republicans, who fiercely disagree on the cost of another stimulus package.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump called on Congress to pass a coronavirus relief bill on Saturday in his first stimulus remarks since losing the election to Joe Biden.</p><p>\"Congress must now do a Covid Relief Bill,\" he wrote on Twitter. \"Needs Democrats support. Make it big and focused. Get it done!\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1327633164823617548?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 14, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Trump's remarks are the first on the subject since Biden won the presidential election. Before November 3, the president constantly called for another stimulus package. At times, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-bigger-stimulus-package-republicans-democrats-congress-amount-more-checks-2020-10\">Trump suggested</a> he could support a larger plan than the $2.4 trillion in further spending that Democrats wanted.</p><p>The White House was negotiating with Democrats on a relief plan but talks collapsed before the election. They haven't restarted, and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mitch-mcconnell-stimulus-trump-sits-out-pelosi-democrats-economy-2020-11\">now taking the lead</a> on another stimulus bill among Republicans while the White House takes a backseat.</p><p>The trajectory of a stimulus package has been fraught with obstacles over the past few months and Trump's comments were unlikely to break the stalemate on Capitol Hill, even with daily coronavirus cases and hospitalizations surging to new highs in recent days. Both parties are pushing for dueling priorities, particularly on the cost of another rescue plan.</p><p>The GOP is pressing for a slimmer relief package similar to the $500 billion measure they unveiled in September and October, which Democrats blocked both times. It contained small business aid funding and public health funds, but it omitted stimulus checks and money for cities.&#160;</p><p>McConnell has argued the improving economy doesn't need a significant level of assistance, citing the falling unemployment rate. \"I don't think the current situation demands a multitrillion-dollar package,\" the Kentucky Republican said Tuesday.</p><p>It appears that another relief package <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stimulus-hit-rock-bottom-congress-deadlocked-on-coronavirus-relief-2020-11\">won't be passed</a> until after Biden takes office in January. The president-elect has <a href=\"https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/111220\">been in contact</a> with Democratic congressional leaders Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi on the matter.</p><p>Democrats <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-democrats-stimulus-plan-congress-unemployment-economy-pass-vote-bill-2020-9\">have called for a large aid plan</a> that includes new federal unemployment benefits, a second round of $1,200 stimulus checks, aid to state and local governments as well as health funding among other initiatives.&#160;</p><p>\"One of the urgent things that need to be done is people need relief right now — right now: small businesses, people who are about to be evicted from their homes because they can't pay their mortgage, unemployment insurance,\" Biden said at a press conference on Tuesday.</p><p>Many economists and Federal Reserve officials are prodding Congress to pass a new relief bill as the recovery shows signs of slowing down. With virus cases spiking, some states are enacting new restrictions and ordering business closures to curb the pathogen's spread.</p><p>\"The main risk we see to that is clearly the further spread of disease here in the United States,\" Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday. \"We've got new cases at a record level, we've seen a number of states begin to reimpose limited activity restrictions, and people may lose confidence that it is safe to go out.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-congress-big-focused-coronavirus-relief-bill-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 2020 16:57:34 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fabd1abf7d1cb0019e3b0b5?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5dd64fe04dc4fd46d8a9ca97377b3fb1","destWidth":4186,"destHeight":3139,"sourceBytes":679774,"destBytes":679774,"author":"jzeballos@businessinsider.com (Joseph Zeballos-Roig)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fabd1b5f7d1cb0019e3b0b6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn7@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-26-360_cbc3fb9b0cfc47dd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sgTRitfH_CY:KkSqhNjd_Ps:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn39@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-761_10c67d118d88af0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sgTRitfH_CY:KkSqhNjd_Ps:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn60@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-31-182_441f84f2af1281c6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sgTRitfH_CY:KkSqhNjd_Ps:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn28@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-37-497_6031896cd29c0516.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/sgTRitfH_CY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn57@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-36-202_e9464e2947085c35.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991894},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"A day-by-day timeline of how Trump is blocking the kind of presidential transition he got from Biden and Obama","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/timeline-of-2016-and-2020-election-transitions-between-trump-obama-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabddc7f24e720018a2ac29?format=jpeg\" alt=\"obama trump oval office rudy four seasons total landscaping\" height=\"976\" width=\"1952\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A composite image of Donald Trump and Barack Obama in the Oval Office during the 2016 presidential transition (left), and Rudy Giuliani outside Four Seasons Total Landscaping, disputing the 2020 election results (right).\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post via Getty Images / John Minchillo/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Trump's refusal to concede the election has complicated President-elect Joe Biden's transition to power.</li>\n<li>The situation in 2020 is a marked contrast to 2016, when Hillary Clinton conceded and the Obama administration made a point on engaging with Trump and his officials.&#160;</li>\n<li>Here is a comparison of what happened each day in 2016 with what is happening now.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump's continued refusal to concede his election loss to President-elect Joe Biden is complicating the traditional handover of the presidency.</p><p>The process of Biden readying himself for power — despite opposition from Trump and his allies&#160; — is a stark contrast to how the Obama administration gave way to Trump when he won four years ago.</p><p>Business Insider has assembled a day-by-day comparison, dated from when the election was called by the majority of the US news media (Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-wins-general-election-against-donald-trump-2020-11\">called the 2020 election</a> some 24 hours earlier than most):</p><h2>Day 1: Hillary Clinton concedes / Trump golfs, insists that he won</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd30af24e720018a2ac1a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"clinton concession and trump plays golf\" height=\"957\" width=\"1914\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>(L) Hillary Clinton concedes in 2016 (R) Trump golfing after election announcement\n<p class=\"copyright\">Matt McClain/The Washington Post via Getty Images / Samuel Corum/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In 2016, Clinton called Trump at around 2.30 a.m. the night of the election to concede his win, <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/nov/08/presidential-election-updates-trump-clinton-news\">The Guardian reported</a>.</p><p>The following day, the General Services Administration (GSA) authorized the release of funds for the presidential transition, <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/general-services-administration-presidential-transition/\">according to CBS News</a>.&#160;</p><p>By lunchtime on November 9, Clinton had made her concession speech. That day, Defense Secretary Ash Carter gave the formal order for a peaceful transition of power, <a href=\"https://theweek.com/speedreads/660984/secretary-defense-ash-carter-sends-memo-staff-demanding-peaceful-transition-power\">according to The Week</a>.&#160;</p><p>In 2020, Trump was at the golf course as major networks called the race for Joe Biden.</p><p>At the same time, his personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, held a press conference in the front yard of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/four-seasons-total-landscaping-selling-merch-after-rudy-giuliani-conference-2020-11\">Four Seasons Total Landscaping</a>, announcing the president's intention to litigate over alleged voter fraud.</p><p>That evening, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1325099845045071873\">Trump tweeted</a>: \"I WON THIS ELECTION, BY A LOT!\"</p><h2>Day 2: Obama handshake / Trump fraud hotline</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd3e3f24e720018a2ac1b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: U.S. President Barack Obama meets with President-elect Donald Trump in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington November 10, 2016. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque\" height=\"2199\" width=\"4398\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Obama meets with President-elect Trump at the White House in Washington, November 10, 2016.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On November 10, 2016, Vice President Joe Biden met <a href=\"https://twitter.com/VP44/status/796853101978390532\">Vice President-Elect Mike Pence</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bux3hGm_wd4\">Melania Trump</a> met First Lady Michelle Obama.</p><p>Trump and Obama took an hour and a half together in the Oval Office, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/11/us/politics/white-house-transition-obama-trump.html\">The New York Times reported</a>, and Obama shook Trump's hand in front of the cameras.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;VP Biden (Archived)  (@VP44) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/796853101978390532?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 10, 2016</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>On November 8 2020, the non-partisan Center for Presidential Transition <a href=\"https://presidentialtransition.org/publications/message-from-the-center-advisory-board/\">released a statement</a> urging Trump to let the transition proceed.&#160;</p><p>Instead, Republicans were soliciting calls to a fraud hotline set up by Trump, which was then <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pranksters-flood-president-trumps-election-fraud-hotline-2020-11\">flooded with prank calls</a>.&#160;</p><p>That day Melania made her first public statement in support of Trump's fraud allegations, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/FLOTUS/status/1325509832594616328\">tweeting</a>: \"Every legal — not illegal — vote should be counted.\"</p><h2>Day 3: Obama preps farewell tour / Trump hypes legal challenges&#160;</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd506f24e720018a2ac1e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biden coronavirus transition team\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>U.S. President-elect Joe Biden takes meets with members of the coronavirus &#34;Transition Advisory Board&#34; in Delaware, November 9, 2020\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jonathan Ernst/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On November 11, 2016, details of Obama's global farewell tour were announced, in which the president said he would be helping prepare allies to work with Trump, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/7759c9d17cf34c2db5ce83102076816d\">the Associated Press reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>Three days after victory in 2020, without a concession from Trump, Biden met with and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-covid-19-advisory-board-coronavirus-panel-vivek-murthy-2020-11\">announced his coronavirus advisory board</a>, designed to mark a break with Trump's chaotic handling of the pandemic.</p><p>On Twitter, Trump continued to hype his claims of election fraud. He sent a total of 25 tweets with links to right-wing media supporting him, or rumors about the count in some states&#160; — many of which were flagged by the platform as disputed.</p><h2>Day 4: Trump plots to undo Obama legacy / Pompeo predicts 'second Trump admin'</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd730f7d1cb0019e3b0c2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biden office of the president-elect speech\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>U.S. President-elect Joe Biden speaks about health care and the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) at the theater serving as his transition headquarters in Wilmington, Delaware, U.S. November 10, 2020\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jonathan Ernst/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On November 12, 2016, Trump named Chris Collins as the head of his transition team, <a href=\"https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-congress/little-known-republican-becomes-trump-liaison-in-congress-idUSKBN13A2YF\">Reuters reported</a>.</p><p>His transition team also signaled to <a href=\"https://nypost.com/2016/11/12/trump-looks-for-ways-to-quickly-withdraw-from-global-climate-deal/\">The New York Post</a> that he planned to pull the US out of the Paris Climate Accords, reversing an Obama policy.</p><p>(Biden has stated that he will cancel the US departure from the accords, foiling Trump's plan.)</p><p>In 2020, four days after the result, Trump's administration was still holding up Biden's progress.</p><p>Secretary of State Mike Pompeo <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pompeo-smooth-transition-2nd-trump-administration-joke-video-2020-11\">joked in a press conference about preparing</a> for a \"second Trump administration,\" for which he was later praised by the president.</p><p>But privately, Trump advisors <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-challenges-state-count/2020/11/10/45148fac-2378-11eb-8672-c281c7a2c96e_story.html\">told The Washington Post</a> that they were privately losing hope over the president's plans to fight the result.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-trump-refusal-to-concede-wont-slow-down-transition-2020-11\">Biden addressed the lack of cooperation at a press conference, telling reporters</a> in Delaware that he was moving ahead anyway: \"We don't see anything that's slowing us down, quite frankly,\" he said.</p><p>He <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-transition-moves-ahead-calls-trump-embarrassment-quote-2020-11\">called Trump's refusal to concede</a>&#160;\"an embarrassment\" but added: \"it's not of much consequence.\"</p><h2>Day 5: New president tries to set an agenda / Old president claims polls are a conspiracy</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fabd877f24e720018a2ac23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump 60 minutes 2016\" height=\"999\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Presidewnt-elect Donald Trump on &#39;60 Minutes&#39; in November 2016\n<p class=\"copyright\">CBS News/YouTube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On November 13 2016, Trump named Reince Priebus as his chief of staff and Steve Bannon as his chief strategist, <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/nov/13/stephen-bannon-reince-priebus-donald-trump-white-house-staff\">The Guardian reported</a>.</p><p>Trump's <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/60-minutes-donald-trump-family-melania-ivanka-lesley-stahl/\">interview with CBS's \"60 Minutes\"</a> aired, in which he shifted from his former hardline position on Obamacare, moderating some of his campaign positions ahead of taking power.</p><p>At the same point in 2020, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1326519025552265216\">Trump continued to lob accusations</a>. This time he attacked ABC News and The Washington Post, arguing that a joint Wisconsin poll they published purposefully understated his chances to discourage his supporters from voting.</p><p>There is no evidence for this. Trump added \"we are now preparing to win the state.\" In fact, Biden won the state, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-presidential-election-2020-live-vote-counts-results-2020\">Business Insider called on November 4</a>.</p><h2>Day 6 - Trump seeks security clearance for his kids / State department blocks messages to Biden</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fad4ded8a86ff001880b23f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ivanka don jr eric trump december 2016\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Donald Trump Jr, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, listen during a meeting with technology industry leaders at Trump Tower in New York, NY on Wednesday, Dec. 14, 2016.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On November 14 2016, Trump asked White House officials to look into getting top secret security clearance for his children Ivanka, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-team-seeks-top-secret-security-clearances-for-trump-children/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-team-seeks-top-secret-security-clearances-for-trump-children/\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">NBC News reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>The move was rejected, but in 2018 he overruled his chief of staff to give the clearance <a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2019/03/ivanka-trump-security-clearance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2019/03/ivanka-trump-security-clearance\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">to Ivanka</a>&#160;and his son-in-law&#160;<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/28/us/politics/jared-kushner-security-clearance.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/28/us/politics/jared-kushner-security-clearance.html\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Jared Kushner</a>.</p><p>On Day 6 in 2020, Biden had still not been given access to messages of congratulation from world leaders by the State Department, <a href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2020/11/11/politics/state-department-biden-messages/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2020/11/11/politics/state-department-biden-messages/index.html\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">CNN reported</a>.</p><p>The State Department traditionally handles such messages for the President-elect, but has refused to hand them over while Trump has not conceded his loss, the network reported.</p><h2>Day 7 - Trump gets first security briefing / China affirms Biden win</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fae80e34652d400197442fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biden xi jinping china\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Chinese President Xi Jinping shakes hands with Joe Biden, as Vice President, in 2013.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lintao Zhang/Pool/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On Day 7 after Donald Trump's election result was confirmed — November 15, 2016 — the president-elect had his first top-secret intelligence briefing, CNN reported.&#160;</p><p>While presidential candidates receive intelligence briefings during their campaigns, this was the first time Trump accessed the Presidential Daily Brief (PDB) — the highest level of security information.&#160;</p><p>It's a key part of the ascent to power. The PDB put the president-elect on the same information footing as the sitting president, telling him about international adversaries and security threats.</p><p>Seven days after Biden's win was confirmed in 2020, he still <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-trump-refusal-to-concede-wont-slow-down-transition-2020-11?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">did not have access</a> to the briefings.</p><p>Despite the Trump administration's refusal to acknowledge Biden's victory, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-says-biden-won-election-russia-last-major-power-silent-2020-11?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">China officially did so</a>. This left Russia as the only major world power not to accept the results.</p><h2>Day 8 - Pence receives first daily briefing/ Biden holds on to Georgia</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fb00420402d49001924efe8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"president trump\" height=\"750\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump walks up to speak about Operation Warp Speed in the Rose Garden at the White House on November 13, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On Day 8 after the 2016 election result was confirmed — November 16, 2016 — Trump's transition team announced that it will require incoming officials to terminate their lobbying registrations, and vow not to lobby again for five years after leaving the administration.</p><p>Vice President Mike Pence, who had been elevated to transition chair, introduced these news measures.</p><p>The president also met with Alabama senator Jeff Sessions and New York City mayor Bill de Blasio.</p><p>On Day 8 in 2020, Biden's legal team in Georgia announced they do not expect a hand recount of votes to change the November 3 election results, solidifying his victory even more.</p><p>Biden is the first Democratic candidate to swing the state since 1992.</p><p>Meanwhile, Trump gave his first public remarks since his electoral defeat, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-threatens-to-withhold-vaccine-new-york-feuds-with-cuomo-2020-11\">appearing in the White House Rose Garden to tout the effectiveness of Operation Warp Speed</a>, his administration's coronavirus vaccine program.</p><p>While speaking to reporters, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/president-trump-slipped-up-close-to-acknowledging-biden-election-win-2020-11\">Trump came very close to admitting that he lost the US presidential election</a>, suggesting \"time will tell\" which administration will be in power next.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/timeline-of-2016-and-2020-election-transitions-between-trump-obama-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 57_c00ed7378fb1f138.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=OFzJTdxqv5k:aOc96VcuQ_E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn17@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-38-168_b3df64925dfd6a1b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/OFzJTdxqv5k":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn76@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-32-344_4f0563a0300ba3b3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991898},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"GEORGIA RESULTS: Biden is projected winner of Georgia","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-presidential-election-2020-live-vote-counts-results-2020","description":"<bi-shortcode id=\"hero-media\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"embed\" data-aspect-ratio=\"56.25%\" data-full-width=\"true\" data-embed-type=\"ddhq\" data-script-src=\"https://embeds.ddhq.io/single/v3/ddhq.load.js?\">&#160;</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President-elect Joe Biden is the projected winner of Georgia following a recount of ballots, according to Decision Desk HQ.&#160;</li>\n<li>Georgia has 16 electoral votes, and it has voted for a Republican in every presidential election since 1996.</li>\n<li>See the live coverage and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-election-results\">full results from the US presidential election</a>.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President-elect Joe Biden is the projected winner of Georgia, Decision Desk HQ projected Saturday.</p><p>On Wednesday, Georgia's Secretary of State ordered a <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-georgia-recount-idUSKBN27R2B9\">manual recount </a>of ballots with a deadline set on November 20.</p><p>Georgia is a Republican stronghold and has voted for a Republican in each of the past six presidential elections.</p><p>Georgia is home to competitive races in the House's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-house-6th-district-election-lucy-mcbath-karen-handel-2020\">6th</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-7th-district-house-election-carolyn-bourdeaux-rich-mccormick-2020\">7th congressional districts</a> as well as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-senate-race-david-perdue-vs-jon-ossoff-polls-fundraising-2020-8\">two</a> highly anticipated <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kelly-loeffler-vs-doug-collins-georgia-senate-election-polls-fundraising-2020-8\">Senate</a> races, both of which went to runoffs.</p><p>The Senate delegation from Georgia, along with the state's legislature and governor, is firmly Republican. Georgia's delegation in the House is split, with eight Republicans and four Democrats.</p><p>Georgia has 16 electoral votes.</p><p>In the state, a candidate can request a recount when the margin between candidates is less than half a percentage point, which appears to be the case.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-presidential-election-2020-live-vote-counts-results-2020'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a (Madison Hall,Bartie Scott,Jake Lahut,Sinéad Baker,Inyoung Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NlTjyqpNIe4:ohaonvHnBkU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn50@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-34-342_a01e97f9069b25ba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NlTjyqpNIe4:ohaonvHnBkU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn7@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-35-798_f93d5612b027e9c6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NlTjyqpNIe4:ohaonvHnBkU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn21@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-35-245_8da45e604edda867.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/NlTjyqpNIe4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn70@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-35-397_f3ecef50df125713.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991818},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"BMW just unveiled its flagship electric SUV with 500 horsepower and 300 miles of range coming in 2022 — see the iX","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bmw-ix-electric-suv-first-look-photos-specs-details-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8e98669500182b5884?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>BMW unveiled its new iX SUV Wednesday &#8212; it'll be the brand's flagship electric vehicle.&#160;</li>\n<li>The SUV claims more than 300 miles of range, more than 500 horsepower, and a 0-60-mph time of under five seconds.&#160;</li>\n<li>It goes into production in late 2021.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>BMW hasn't launched a new electric vehicle in the US in quite some time.</p><p>It brought the i3 hatchback to market seven years ago when the mainstream EV market was still in its earliest stages. Since then, loads of economy and luxury brands have stepped into the space and EV startups have come and gone, but the Bavarian brand has stayed relatively quiet.</p><p>All that is about to change, however. BMW on Wednesday <a href=\"https://www.press.bmwgroup.com/global/article/detail/T0319728EN/the-first-ever-bmw-ix?language=en\">unveiled the iX</a>, the carmaker's new flagship electric SUV that's set to hit US streets in 2022. The X5-sized SUV sports plenty of range, two motors with enough power to hit 62 mph in under five seconds, and some controversial styling features — like BMW's new and enlarged version of its classic kidney grille.&#160;</p><p>Although the iX is BMW's first purpose-built electric SUV, the brand's parent company, the BMW Group, has made headway on its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/promises-carmakers-have-made-about-their-future-electric-vehicles-2020-1#bmw-group-7\">goal</a> to offer 25 electric and hybrid vehicles by 2023. It launched the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bmw-unveils-fully-electric-mini-cooper-available-2020-2019-10\">$30,000 Mini Cooper SE</a> last fall, and the non-US-market iX3 this summer.&#160;</p><p>Take a closer look at the iX — BMW's answer to the Audi E-Tron and Tesla Model X — below.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tBMW hasn't released all the details of the iX yet, but here's what we know so far about the electric SUV.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faed114402d49001924edc9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1191\" width=\"1589\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's based on a new, adjustable platform and electric powertrain that BMW will use for other vehicles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a867f8f4200182a669c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe SUV will have two motors — one at each axle — that provide more than 500 horsepower, according to BMW.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faed16e1c741f0019ac9b65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1345\" width=\"1793\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBMW claims the iX will accelerate from 0-62 mph in under five seconds, potentially rivaling the Model X Long Range Plus, which hits 60 in a claimed 4.4 seconds.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8698669500182b5880?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBMW is aiming for an EPA-estimated range of more than 300 miles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a867f8f4200182a669b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe battery can be charged from 10% to 80% in under 40 minutes, and drivers can add 75 miles of range in ten minutes of charging.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8b98669500182b5883?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAs far as styling goes, the iX is definitely eye-catching.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8b98669500182b5881?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt sports the same gigantic, polarizing kidney grille that adorns the latest M3 and M4.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8b98669500182b5882?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut, seeing as the powertrain doesn't require that much cooling, the grille hides the iX's cameras, radar, and other sensors instead of pulling in air.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a8e98669500182b5885?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe iX's interior is refreshingly minimal.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a927f8f4200182a669f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere's a curved display for the infotainment system and gauges.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a9098669500182b5886?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd between the seats, there's a knob for the infotainment system and a rocker switch for changing gears.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a6c98669500182b587e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBMW says it constructed a large portion of the interior out of \"recycled and natural materials.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a947f8f4200182a66a0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd some of these initial photos show a cool design pattern on the seats.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac6a967f8f4200182a66a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe iX goes into production in the second half of 2021 and is set to hit US dealerships in 2022.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faedd051c741f0019ac9bb0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BMW iX\" height=\"1047\" width=\"1396\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BMW iX.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 9500182b587e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn41@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-35-263_1f82889bb19a0595.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fac6a947f8f4200182a66a0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-29-032_af6b4ca1c500e6f6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fac6a967f8f4200182a66a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn71@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-26-971_63de3a22117ff893.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faedd051c741f0019ac9bb0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn31@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-36-040_5706f55c5d1ed31c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpJjD9V5oAI:4Xliq-NYNaw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn32@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-27-764_303d56426da5df09.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpJjD9V5oAI:4Xliq-NYNaw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-29-400_ceb4b1c65aeee5a8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XpJjD9V5oAI:4Xliq-NYNaw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-25-117_93178fe797df8a50.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/XpJjD9V5oAI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn82@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-36-440_a11c0bae84de1ea3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991878},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"I'm a 36-year-old luxury real estate agent in Park City, Utah, where the market is sizzling and we're seeing a huge influx of Silicon Valley workers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/job-diary-real-estate-agent-in-park-city-utah-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c3e31df1d50018218acf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Liza Story\" height=\"1230\" width=\"1640\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Liza Story is a Park City, Utah, native and has been working in real estate since 2009.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Liza Story</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Liza Story is a 36-year-old realtor in Park City, Utah &#8212; a 40-minute drive from Salt Lake City &#8212; where the real estate market is hot.</li>\n<li>During the pandemic, she's noticed a barrage of buyers fleeing California to escape wildfires and city lockdowns; people who can now do their jobs from anywhere want to live in the mountains.&#160;</li>\n<li>Park City is an easy sell, given its beautiful location, small-town vibe, and luxury ski resort amenities.</li>\n<li>She's sold six homes in the last six weeks, ranging from $450,000 to $1.7 million in price, and says that construction in the area can't keep up with the demand.</li>\n<li>This is what her job is like, as told to freelance writer Amber Gibson.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>I grew up in Park City, Utah, so I consider myself a true local. It's still a small town, with less than 9,000 residents, but we have hundreds of thousands of visitors each year.&#160;</p><p>Park City offers such a seamless outdoor lifestyle, and I always try to show my clients what I love about this town. There's been a lot of growth and development over the past 20 years, but we've kept the small-town, ski resort atmosphere alive. That's what people like about coming here.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c7a91df1d50018218af1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty\" height=\"2652\" width=\"3546\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The main street of Park City after snow in winter 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I've sold six homes in the last six weeks, each averaging around $2 million. People want to get in now before the ski season begins and the cold weather settles in. Inventory is at a <a href=\"https://www.parkcityrealtors.com/www.parkcityrealtors.com/newsroom\">10-year low</a> and going quickly, so there's not a lot available. Construction just can't keep up with <a href=\"https://www.kpcw.org/post/park-city-area-real-estate-market-roars-back-after-initial-post-covid-worry#stream/0\">demand</a>, and there are more buyers than there are sellers.&#160;</p><p>The demographic is the same; mainly families and couples who vacation here regularly. They're the ones who know they love it here and now want to make it a full-time home. But lately, I've met with more buyers coming from Northern California.</p><p><em><strong>Read more</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/job-diary-interior-designer-who-creates-dream-luxury-playrooms-2020-10\">I design $100,000 luxury playrooms for the children of wealthy execs and celebrities. Business is wild right now — here's what my job is like.</a></em></p><h2><strong>This year, there's been a big influx of Silicon Valley and Bay Area people moving here</strong></h2><p>During the pandemic, they can work remotely and be right in the mountains. People called Salt Lake City \"Silicon Slopes\" even before COVID-19, but the pandemic has definitely solidified that.&#160;</p><p>Many people prefer Park City to Salt Lake because you get more of the small-town luxury experience here.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c8ee1df1d50018218afa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty\" height=\"2682\" width=\"3577\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes in the Old Town neighborhood of Park City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I've been a full-time realtor since 2009, when I started as an experience curator at The Colony at White Pine Canyon, a gated community of ski-in, ski-out homes. I coordinated hospitality events for homeowners and guests.</p><p>There I learned that buying and selling is not just about walking through a home, but about curating memorable moments for your clients. You're not just selling real estate; you're selling a lifestyle.&#160;</p><h2><strong>In Park City, we sell the lifestyle of a small-town, luxury mountain getaway</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c6111df1d50018218ae7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Early Balcony View   The Residences at The St. Regis Deer Valley _ Snow Park City\" height=\"1468\" width=\"1958\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The view from a residence balcony at The St. Regis Deer Valley in Park City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">The St. Regis Deer Valley</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Over the years, I've designed a member yurt for The Colony at White Pine Canyon, where we did special events like ski-in, ski-out lunches and snowmobile tours. At <a href=\"https://www.montagehotels.com/deervalley/\">Montage Deer Valley</a>, a hotel with residences, I sold the full-service, five-star ownership experience. There, two to five-bedroom condos ranged in price anywhere from $2 million to $10 million.&#160;</p><p>From Park City, Salt Lake International Airport is only 35 minutes away. This offers easy access to professionals who still need to travel for work or prefer to spend their time in Park City on the weekends.</p><p>It's about having everything at your fingertips. You can ski out your front door, your skis are waxed and stored for you, and you can enjoy an incredible experience at one of the <a href=\"http://blog.deervalley.com/deer-valley-ranked-1-ski-resort-in-north-america-for-2018-by-ski-magazine-readers/\">number one ski resorts in the world.</a> It's not about looking at units, it's about enjoying Deer Valley chili (a famous recipe from a local cafe) and taking to the slopes.</p><h2><strong>I always strive to be authentic and not just a salesperson</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faa828f1df1d50018219c89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Liza Story\" height=\"1566\" width=\"2088\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Liza Story.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Liza Story</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>People don't just want to hear statistics anymore; they want to understand why a house will be great for their family and for entertaining, and why it's somewhere they'll want to spend a lot of time.</p><p>The St. Regis Deer Valley is the latest resort expanding their real estate by offering with nine new residences at <a href=\"https://srdvresidences.com\">Snow Park</a>. Locals love taking the funicular up to have dinner at <a href=\"https://www.srdvdining.com/rime-at-the-st-regis-deer-valley\">RIME Seafood + Steak,</a>&#160;and lounging by the pool during warmer weather.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.srdvdining.com/rime-at-the-st-regis-deer-valley\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faa82a9f7d1cb0019e3abb4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"(V) St. Regis Deer Valley Pool\" height=\"821\" width=\"1094\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at The St. Regis Deer Valley resort.\n<p class=\"copyright\">The St. Regis Deer Valley</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>I started my own business in 2018 and I'm working as a real estate associate for Summit Sotheby's International Realty. They are my broker, brand, and company.</p><h2>My day-to-day schedule is flexible and varies constantly.</h2><p>I really never know what is going to come up — buyers and sellers always have new or last-minute requests. My hours are not consistent or normal: Some days I start as early as 8 a.m., and others I can be working up into the late hours of the night.</p><p>COVID-19 hasn't especially affected my routine. Now, I mainly just have more virtual instead of face-to-face meetings. I miss the in-person connection, but I try to look at it optimistically, in that I can get more meetings in during the week and have less travel time.</p><h2>I can work up to seven days a week, including on holidays.</h2><p>I try to plan one full day each week that I take for myself and family time, but sometimes that doesn't happen. A flexible schedule can be a perk, but it also can make it tricky to schedule a true vacation.</p><p>Typically, I have several Zoom meetings every week with fellow agents of Sotheby's where we get caught up on newly active, recently under contract, and sold inventory. I also have a marketing meeting with our in-house advertising agency to discuss strategy and company highlights, and training/continuing education with our in-house council to learn about current issues that are coming up in the market and to stay up to date on legal aspects.</p><p>My days are also filled with buyer meetings, listing appointments with new sellers, staging houses, selecting photos or videos for online listings, meeting inspectors and vendors for bids, scheduling appraisals, catching up with lenders and title companies, and connecting with my database of clients.</p><p>Real estate is not as easy as some people think, and I believe a good agent makes this career their primary focus.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c88569331a0011bc71a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty\" height=\"2656\" width=\"3541\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A home in Park City that was built in 1913 that Story sold in October for nearly $1.7 million.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>When I first meet a potential buyer, I do my best to quickly nail down what their ideal ski home looks like. The market moves quickly, and inventory is limited, so it's important to have a clear understanding of what they want.</p><p>Of course, there are difficult clients, like in any industry has zero problem clients. Sometimes we have to deal with buyers or sellers making weird requests for making repairs, or keeping and selling personal items.</p><p>During the pandemic, I've worked with several clients who are eager to buy a house without even seeing it in person, only by virtual tour.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c9c669331a0011bc71b1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty\" height=\"2644\" width=\"3525\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The newly renovated kitchen inside a home that Story sold in October.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Buyers are doing their diligence, but the process is getting shorter and quicker. It normally takes at least a week to close a negotiation, but if you're working with a great agent, you can shorten that timeline because you're working with somebody who understands the market.</p><p><em><strong>Read more</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/important-money-moves-make-first-year-homeowner-manage-finances-save\">7 moves to make in your first year as a homeowner to save money and spend wisely, according to personal finance experts</a></em></p><h2><strong>Colorado is a popular ski destination, but I make it my job to sell buyers on Utah</strong></h2><p>At Park City, we're just a four hour-drive away from warmer climates in Moab, Jackson Hole, or Sun Valley. We get gorgeous fall, summer, and spring seasons, as well as winter.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c92b69331a0011bc71ab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty\" height=\"2655\" width=\"3541\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A winter snowfall in Park City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Summit Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Nobody has a crystal ball in real estate and it's hard to predict anything, but historically, real estate can be a wise investment. If you can buy at the right time, in an up-and-coming town, there's no telling how much your investment may be worth in just a few years.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/job-diary-real-estate-agent-in-park-city-utah-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
