Gibson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa1c3e31df1d50018218acf?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn87@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-32-475_ed85e0b20f5a3af5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c7a91df1d50018218af1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-27-300_17caaecd5b73880e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c8ee1df1d50018218afa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn94@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-33-734_6bacd1afcb88c4bc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c6111df1d50018218ae7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn89@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-338_fd82f5995e95c6a8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faa828f1df1d50018219c89?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn29@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-34-240_6d6d96d31a99c67d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faa82a9f7d1cb0019e3abb4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn47@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-29-034_a3faca62d3f371f8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c88569331a0011bc71a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn14@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-38-157_daa978cf63da0a2b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c9c669331a0011bc71b1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn89@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-34-816_b4c290e36e9cf79a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa1c92b69331a0011bc71ab?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn3@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-24-962_cbbadc5e1c7e15bf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ui7tvur02Mw:hqFoYmLrfNo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn30@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-39-069_97f53c869450fdb4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ui7tvur02Mw:hqFoYmLrfNo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn67@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-28-184_31ca8d6f220b091c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ui7tvur02Mw:hqFoYmLrfNo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn60@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-24-998_315ee7963c3c3d40.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Ui7tvur02Mw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn41@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-39-063_e28b116aad7528a0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991838},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Pelosi calls McConnell a 'yes man' and says his power will diminish come the Biden administration","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-says-mcconnells-power-will-diminish-come-the-biden-presidency-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef89bce1918243bbb099a75?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nancy pelosi\" height=\"683\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) speaks during a press conference to mark the anniversary of the House passage of the 19th Amendment and women&#39;s right to vote, on Capitol Hill May 21, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/speaker-of-the-house-nancy-pelosi-speaks-during-a-press-news-photo/1214409760?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will yield less power in Congress come January once President-elect Joe Biden takes office.&#160;</li>\n<li>\"Whether you're in the minority or majority, if the president is of your party, you have more power,\" she said.</li>\n<li>\"And I think that's what Mitch McConnell is going to find out now,\" Pelosi added.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on <a href=\"https://www.c-span.org/video/?478051-1/house-speaker-nancy-pelosi-holds-news-conference\">Friday</a> said Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will have less power in Congress once President-elect Joe Biden takes office.&#160;</p><p>Speaking to reporters during her weekly news conference, Pelosi called McConnell a \"yes man\" who she claimed showed up in her office often saying, \"I'm not doing anything Donald Trump doesn't want.\"&#160;</p><p>\"So to me, that was like an abdication of your first branch of government responsibility,\" Pelosi said about McConnell's remarks. \"You're just going to do whatever the president wants? No. This is a separation of power. Something very very important. The genius of our Constitution,\" Pelosi said.</p><p>The lawmaker, a California Democrat, also said McConnell's power in Congress is short-lived. Once Biden is inaugurated as president in January, McConnell's influence will diminish.&#160;</p><p>\"May I remind you that we have a president of the United States, we have a president of the United States. That is so very important. And whether you're in the minority or majority, if the president is of your party, you have more power,\" she said.</p><p>\"And I think that's what Mitch McConnell is going to find out now, that whether you're in the majority or the minority, not having Donald Trump in the White House is going to change his leverage and that dynamic,\" she added.</p><p>McConnell's office did not immediately respond to Business Insider's request for comment.</p><p>McConnell and Pelosi have been at odds in the last four years, most recently during a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/republicans-democrats-stimulus-disagreements-pelosi-trump-mcconnell-aid-bill-differences-2020-10\">months-long, partisan stalemate over the contents of the next coronavirus stimulus package</a>.&#160;</p><p>Congress has stalled putting out a second relief bill as Democrats and Republicans <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stimulus-hit-rock-bottom-congress-deadlocked-on-coronavirus-relief-2020-11\">remain deadlocked</a> on how much money to allocate for the package. Top Dems including Pelosi have been calling for a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-democrats-stimulus-plan-congress-unemployment-economy-pass-vote-bill-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"f4442d4ffa580050ae866c585641882c\">a $2.4 trillion stimulus package</a> but McConnell and other Republicans are not budging for a package over $500 billion.</p><p>\"So, again for the good of the country, I am so overjoyed that Joe Biden is president of United States, his decency, his vision, his values,\" Pelosi added. \"But I also know that he respects the legislative branch, and that there's a collaboration and we will work together to put legislation together.\"</p><p>Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-election-results\">called the presidency</a> for Biden on Friday, November 6, but few Republican senators, including McConnell, have publicly acknowledged Biden's victory against President Trump. But the incoming Biden administration has been <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senators-privately-contacting-biden-while-publicly-very-few-have-2020-11\">speaking privately with some GOP senators</a>, indicating they might be willing to work with the former vice president come January.&#160;</p><p>Biden has previously said he would try to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-would-consider-republican-running-mate-unity-ticket-2019-12\">work across the aisle</a> and collaborate with Democrats and Republicans in both chambers of Congress.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-says-mcconnells-power-will-diminish-come-the-biden-presidency-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_JtLiq7_mdQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 14:49:29 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8c72dfc21cfb0019468a84?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5713df9d679f26206eba16f99696adce","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn1@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-40-366_318f0dec07f4caa9.webp","destWidth":910,"destHeight":683,"sourceBytes":33994,"destBytes":33994,"author":"ydzhanova@businessinsider.com (Yelena Dzhanova)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ef89bce1918243bbb099a75?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn19@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-25-012_24c05967bdebd62d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn63@2020_3/2020/11/14/17-30-33-408_982d375cdcb89758.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn93@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-36-765_8b44cff2ec67966f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_JtLiq7_mdQ:G3QGm2BAsws:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_JtLiq7_mdQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn95@2020_6/2020/11/14/17-30-26-127_a565339e3a8da243.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991837},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Salesforce was supposed to become a diversity role model. Here's why its Office of Equality has struggled to move the needle.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/salesforce-push-to-improve-equality-yielded-slow-results-tony-prophet-2020-11","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa5c60ff7d1cb0019e3a59e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"benioff_prophet\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   (L to R) Tony Prophet, Salesforce chief equality and recruiting officer and Marc Benioff, Salesforce CEO and cofounder \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Steve Jennings/Getty Images, Kimberly White/Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>Salesforce is known as a leader on social change, exemplified by hiring Tony Prophet as its first ever chief equality office in 2016.</li> \n <li>There's no clear roadmap for businesses to follow when changing diversity and progress is often slow, but in four years, Salesforce's diversity numbers have barely budged.&nbsp;</li> \n <li>Business Insider spoke to 18 current and former Salesforce employees, diversity and inclusion experts, as well as Prophet himself to learn how Salesforce's Office of Equality operates and why its hasn't seen faster results.&nbsp;</li> \n <li><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Are you a&nbsp;</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Salesforce</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">&nbsp;employee? Contact these reporters via the encrypted messaging app Signal (</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">+1-309-265-6120</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">&nbsp;or&nbsp;</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">925-364-4258</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">) or email (</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"mailto:jwilliams@businessinsider.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"mailto:jwilliams@businessinsider.com\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">jwilliams@businessinsider.com</a></em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">,&nbsp;</em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"mailto:pzaveri@businessinsider.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"mailto:pzaveri@businessinsider.com\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">pzaveri@businessinsider.com</a></em></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">).</em></strong></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>When employees arrive at Salesforce's imposing 61-story tower in San Francisco's South of Market district, it's not uncommon to be greeted by Tony Prophet. The 58-year old executive, impeccably-dressed, regularly works the lobby like a proud owner of a new home, eagerly introducing himself to some of the enterprise software giant's roughly 54,000 workers.</p>\n<p>Prophet is Salesforce's Chief Equality Officer, and his passion and trademark pizzazz are visible in everything his group does, from sophisticated Twitter campaigns to high-wattage events with celebrity guests like Janelle Monáe and Mila Kunis.</p>\n<p>The prominent emphasis on diversity is in character with the company's reputation as the tech industry's moral compass for social justice and progressive ideals. Marc Benioff, Salesforce's CEO and founder, pioneered the notion of donating 1% of the company's equity, 1% of its employees' time, and 1% of its product to philanthropic causes. He led tech's charge against Indiana's contentious \"bathroom bill.\" His latest book, \"Trailblazer,\" is a treatise on creating a fulfilling corporate culture.</p>\n<p>But behind the high-profile diversity push is an inconvenient truth: Four years after Prophet was hired by Benioff to launch the new group, Salesforce's <a href=\"https://equalitydata.herokuapp.com/\">employee diversity numbers have barely budged</a>. Earlier this month, <a href=\"https://www.salesforce.com/news/stories/our-2020-annual-equality-update/\">Salesforce released its latest equality report</a>: The number of Black employees in Salesforce's US workforce is now 3.5%, compared to <a href=\"https://www.salesforce.com/content/dam/web/en_us/www/assets/pdf/datasheets/sustainability-report-fy1516.pdf\">2% in 2015</a>; The rate of improvement for Latinx representation is especially meager, inching up from 4% in 2015 to 4.5% in the company's latest report.</p>\n<p>People of color are underrepresented at the leadership level, as well, with Black representation clocking in just slightly above 2% for US execs at and above the VP level.</p>\n<p>Salesforce's mediocre diversity results are about the same as the rest of the tech industry, which is to say, abysmal. Google's 3.9% Black representation in its US workforce and Microsoft's 4.5% ratio are slightly above Salesforce, though both have much larger workforces, and Microsoft has been recruiting from historically black colleges since the late 1990s.</p>\n<p>Prophet admits that progress has been slower than he'd like.</p>\n<p>\"We would be the first to acknowledge that there is much more work to do, and there are places where we could have gone faster in hindsight,\" Prophet told Business Insider in an interview.</p>\n<p>While Prophet says the pieces are now in place for diversity to accelerate, the track record of the last four years begs the question of why even a company like Salesforce — with vast financial resources, a publicly supportive CEO and engineers with the smarts to tackle artificial intelligence — hasn't been able to move the needle more significantly when it comes to building a representative workforce.</p>\n<p>Business Insider spoke to 18 current and former Salesforce employees, as well as several diversity and inclusion experts, to see firsthand how tech's role-model company has tried to solve the industry's longstanding diversity problem and why it hasn't worked better.</p>\n<p>Without a playbook to turn to, Salesforce's Equality Office has had to learn a lot on the fly. Unlike some of Salesforce's previous equality achievements, such as spending millions to close its gender wage gap, the deep-rooted inequities in society that reach into corporate America are not so easily fixed.</p>\n<p>According to many of the people Business Insider spoke to, Salesforce's celebrated equality project is beset by fundamental flaws that have blunted its impact — and for some, even raised doubts about the $240 billion company's commitment to match fanfare with hard work.</p>\n<p>As a pioneer for progressive values, Salesforce's ability to recognize its shortcomings, and learn from them, is being watched closely inside and outside the company.</p>\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/salesforce-office-of-equality-tony-prophet-struggled-get-results-2020-11?r=teezr\">Click here to read the full story and subscribe to Business Insider premium</a></h2>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/salesforce-push-to-improve-equality-yielded-slow-results-tony-prophet-2020-11\">Business Insider</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"feedflare\"> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/YOTNMTexOEA\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Nov 2020 14:00:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5faf0203402d49001924ef36?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0c5153552dccf3afd6431dc2b4baf316","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn77@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-40-100_653fc5c248bd929b.webp","destWidth":1514,"destHeight":1135,"sourceBytes":18258,"destBytes":18258,"author":"pzaveri@businessinsider.com (Paayal Zaveri,Joe Williams)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa5c60ff7d1cb0019e3a59e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn71@2020_4/2020/11/14/17-30-31-257_9967b1b033c8da93.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn73@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-37-247_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn79@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-34-231_c20d78d4590e91cf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn16@2020_5/2020/11/14/17-30-36-026_5e8dde13a5e7464b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-31-512_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=YOTNMTexOEA:ytEDM1ARM7w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn59@2020_1/2020/11/14/17-30-34-678_b51e0cdc9b2f1f90.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/YOTNMTexOEA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn66@2020_2/2020/11/14/17-30-36-348_c9ff29a1e9840407.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1605374991853},{"createdTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","updatedTime":"2020-11-15 01:29:51","title":"Inside the new world's longest flight: What it's like to fly on Singapore Airlines' new route between Singapore and New York","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-the-new-worlds-longest-flight-singapore-airlines-a350-tour-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fad7bd41e8d500019813285?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Singapore Airlines launched a new world's longest flight by distance on Monday, flying non-stop between Singapore and New York.</li>\n<li>The route has a great circle distance of 8,287 nautical miles with the longest segment scheduled for 18 hours and 40 minutes</li>\n<li>An Airbus A350-900 XWB is used for the flights offering 253 seats in a three-class configuration consisting of business, premium economy, and economy classes.&#160;</li>\n<li>We hopped onboard the aircraft being used on the route before the first return flight from New York to Singapore on Wednesday.&#160;</li>\n</ul>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Singapore Airlines just launched its newest route on Monday between Singapore and New York City, offering the only non-stop flights directly between the two cities.</p><p>With a great circle distance of 8,287 nautical miles, the route is the longest in the world by mileage. It overtakes the recently relaunched <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/longest-flight-in-the-world-singapore-airlines-business-class-review-2018-10\">Singapore Airlines' non-stop route to nearby Newark, New Jersey</a> by a mere two nautical miles, although <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/singapore-airlines-new-worlds-longest-flight-to-nyc-2020-10\">the airline doesn't see it that way</a>.&#160;</p><p>Flight times for the route are scheduled at a whopping 18 hours and five minutes on the New York-bound leg, flight SQ24, and 18 hours and 40 minutes for the flight back to Singapore, flight SQ23. For this route, the airline chose the Airbus A350-900 XWB with three cabins including business, premium economy, and economy classes.</p><p>So yes, it's possible to fly nearly 19 hours in economy and in a middle seat, though most flying in the cabin will likely have entire rows to themselves.&#160;</p><p>The route comes at a peculiar time for international travel as Americans can't enter Singapore for tourism or business so carrying cargo will help the airline pay the bills for this flight. As soon as the world opens up again, however, the flights should be filled with eager passengers looking to explore the world again.&#160;</p><p>We toured the aircraft before its inaugural flight back to Singapore. Here's what it's like aboard a Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB flying on the world's longest flight.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe new flights utilize Terminal 4 at New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport, where Singapore Airlines has a cargo facility to process the freight also being carried onboard.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fad7b87343ad40018a937da?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1416\" width=\"1888\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlights to Singapore on the airline from JFK were previously operated with an Airbus A380 and required a stop in Frankfurt, Germany but the Airbus A350-900 XWB can fly the route non-stop, especially with fewer than normal passengers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadadfd1e8d5000198133f6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"781\" width=\"1041\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe non-stop flight is a huge achievement for the airline but because of the circumstance under which it was operating, there'd be no traditional inaugural celebrations, speeches by ambassadors about the importance of the route, or festivities at the departure gate.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae064652d400197441dd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines World&#39;s Longest Flight\" height=\"879\" width=\"1172\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The boarding gate for SQ23 from New York City to Singapore.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFace masks must be worn for the entire flight, upwards of 18 hours, and passengers must have their temperature taken and submit a health declaration to the airline at check-in.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae161e8d5000198133f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1803\" width=\"2404\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOnce onboard, the 253-seat jet has three cabins including a 42-seat business class cabin...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae1d1e8d5000198133fa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA 24-seat premium economy class cabin...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fad9c414652d40019744174?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd 187-seat economy class cabin.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae274652d400197441de?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe business class cabins occupy the first 11 rows, arranged in a 1-2-1 configuration.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae2d4652d400197441df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's split between two cabins, with this larger space between the two boarding doors housing seven rows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae3a1e8d5000198133fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere's also a four-row section just behind the second boarding door. The seats are the same in both cabins but this smaller section has a more exclusive feel.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae491e8d5000198133fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAll seats are forward-facing with direct aisle access, perfect for getting up to stretch out during an ultra-long-haul flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae4e4652d400197441e1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlong the cabin wall in business class are singular seats with unobstructed access to the window and ideal for solo travelers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae541e8d5000198133fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut if traveling with a companion, the center aisle seats offer the ideal shared experience for the journey.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae581e8d5000198133fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAll seats on the aircraft feature personal in-flight entertainment and the largest screens, of course, are in business class.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae604652d400197441e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe 18-inch high-definition screens offer access to movies, television shows, games, and music, everything that one needs to pass the time on the world's longest flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae674652d400197441e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/longest-flight-in-the-world-singapore-airlines-business-class-review-2018-10#you-use-this-retractable-controller-which-has-traditional-buttons-and-a-central-touchscreen-29\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n\tThe system is actually not touch-screen in business class but can be controlled via this remote or by pairing a mobile device. Flyers can also browse the system pre-flight and create a playlist before stepping onboard.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae6c1e8d5000198133ff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://thepointsguy.com/reviews/singapore-airlines-business-class-airbus-a350-900-ulr/\">The Points Guy&#160;</a></em></p>\n\tA veritable throne, the seats are oversized and offer more space and cushioning than the traditional business class seats.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae711e8d500019813400?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOffering 28 inches of width, they're ideal for stretching out on the near-19-hour journey to Singapore.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae754652d400197441e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seatguru.com/airlines/Singapore_Air/Singapore_Air_Airbus_A350-900.php\">Seat Guru</a></em></p>\n\tThe seat's functionality is controlled via these buttons with options to recline, turn on the personal reading lamp, and even let flight attendants know that you don't want to be disturbed during meal times, among others.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae7c4652d400197441e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen it's time to go to bed, the seat goes fully flat and flight attendants will assemble the bed. As any seasoned business travelers will tell you, sleep is key on these long journeys.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae811e8d500019813401?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe shell-like walls with head-level dividers offer additional privacy from the aisle in lieu of closable doors.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae894652d400197441e6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd if traveling alone in one of the center aisle seats, a small partition can be separate the pair. It's also useful if a couple is using the seats and each partner needs some alone time.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae8f1e8d500019813403?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn-seat power is available through a 110v AC power outlet and USB charging port. WiFi is available so flyers can also get work done on this flight, the duration of which is longer than two eight-hour workdays.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae954652d400197441e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe tray table is solid and moves forward and backward based on preference. Two full meals are served on this flight and as part of the airline's pandemic related safety measures, business class meals are served on a single tray instead of a more elaborate service.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae9a4652d400197441e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.google.com/flights?hl=en#flt=SIN./m/02_286.2020-12-09;c:USD;e:1;s:0;sc:b;sd:1;t:f;tt:o\">Google Flights</a></em></p>\n\tThere's also no shortage of storage space at these seats with a seemingly endless number of nooks and compartments.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadae9f1e8d500019813404?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhether it be a passport, mobile phone, or tablet, there's enough room to store it all during the flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaea41e8d500019813405?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnderneath the seat, there's a place to store your shoes so they don't get caught up in the seat when converting to the lie-flat position.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaea81e8d500019813406?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeats even have a small mirror so flyers can assemble themselves before landing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaeae4652d400197441ea?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUltimately, this is the cabin in which you'd want to fly 8,287 nautical miles as it offers the most personal space, gourmet meals, and a full entertainment suite.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaeb31e8d500019813407?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeats in this cabin start at over $3,500 one-way.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaeb71e8d500019813408?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDirectly behind business class is the premium economy class, the smallest on the aircraft with only three rows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fad9c414652d40019744174?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOnly 28 seats can be found in this cabin, arranged in a standard 2-4-2 configuration.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaec34652d400197441ec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPaired seats can be found along the cabin wall, ideal for couples or solo travelers, while the center aisle is better for larger groups.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaec84652d400197441ed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThese seats boast a width of 19 inches, one more than regular economy, but a 38-inch pitch that makes the journey more bearable.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaece4652d400197441ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd down below, there's even a footrest.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaed51e8d50001981340a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAmenities at each seat include a personal in-flight entertainment screen,  personal reading lamp, 110v AC power outlet, USB charging port, coat hangar, water bottle holder, adjustable headrest, and pillow and blanket kit.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaeda1e8d50001981340b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOne of the major selling points for these seats is the 13.3-inch high-definition in-flight entertainment screen. These are touch-screen and can also be controlled by a remote.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaedf4652d400197441f0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/singapore-airlines-worlds-longest-flight-premium-economy-review-2018-11#each-seat-is-equipped-with-a-133-inch-high-definition-touchscreen-running-singapores-krisworld-entertainment-system-19\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n\tThe tray table is housed in the armrest. It's a solid piece and adjustable.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaee34652d400197441f1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd finally, the economy cabin takes up the last 21 rows with 187 seats.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaee91e8d50001981340c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt starts with a small six-seat cabin housing 51 seats, bordered by the premium economy section and a row of lavatories.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaeef1e8d50001981340d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe larger rear cabin houses the final 16 rows with 136 seats in total.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaef54652d400197441f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeats in economy are configured in the standard 3-3-3 configuration for the A350, which means that a passenger could get stuck in a middle seat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaefb4652d400197441f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut the flight won't be filling up too much in its early days for that to be a problem.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf001e8d50001981340e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEach seat offers 32 inches of pitch and 18 inches of width.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf061e8d50001981340f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere are also touch-screen in-flight entertainment systems with 11-inch screens. There are no remotes at these seats but the system does have device pairing capabilities.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf0b4652d400197441f4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://thepointsguy.com/2016/10/where-to-sit-singapore-a350-economy/#:~:text=Economy%20seats%20are%2018%20inches,least%2032%20inches%20of%20pitch.&#38;text=This%20aircraft%20has%20two%20economy,and%20one%20at%20the%20back.\">The Points Guy</a></em></p>\n\tThe tray table is foldable and even comes with a mirror. This setting would be ideal for enjoying a beverage, for example.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf104652d400197441f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd then when it's time to eat or do work on a laptop, it can extend fully.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf161e8d500019813411?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor small cups, there's even a standalone cup holder.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf1a4652d400197441f6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn-seat power is offered through a passenger-facing 110v AC power outlet and USB charging port.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf1f4652d400197441f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe multi-layer seat-back pocket offers seat storage and is also contoured for additional shin space.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf241e8d500019813412?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd headrests are adjustable to get the best fit for each passenger.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf291e8d500019813413?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe economy class cabin is what separates this flight from the Singapore-Newark flight, which only had business class and premium economy class.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf2f4652d400197441f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut offering economy will open this flight to more passengers who rely on it to get home or for essential travel, offering the convenience of a non-stop flight without the high prices of a business class or premium economy class ticket.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf344652d400197441fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd if the flights do remain empty, an economy flyer could find themselves with an entire row to themselves.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf3a4652d400197441fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis is the business end of the aircraft, the cockpit.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf3f4652d400197441fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAs one of Airbus' newest jets, the A350 has an advanced cockpit setup with no shortage of high-definition screens to replace traditional gauges.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf444652d400197441ff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEverything the pilot needs is at the click of a mouse, including aeronautical and airport charts.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf491e8d500019813416?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTwo sets of crew take turns flying the aircraft, swapping multiple times during the fleet due to its extended length.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf4e1e8d500019813417?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd in between shifts, they'll retire to a crew rest area for some much-needed sleep.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fadaf521e8d500019813418?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB\" height=\"1749\" width=\"2333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Singapore Airlines Airbus A350-900 XWB operating the world&#39;s longest flight between Singapore and New York.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
